name: Hotel Les Cascades
description: Located near the market on a hill where weavers practice their trade, friendly staff, very good value restaurant, they let us camp for free in the car park and we offered to eat in the restaurant, please do the same!

name: Chez Laura, Jacqueville, Côte D'Ivoire
description: Camping 10,000 CFA  & 5 rondavels @ 15,000cfa. Limited options in area.

name: Chez Jules, Grand Drewin Bay
description: CFA 5000 per night. Chilled campsite next to village on beautiful beach, no-one bothers you. Very friendly rasta surfer dudes run place .

name: hotel Jean Mermoz
description: budget hotel with big parking. we negotiated to camp on the car in parking lot for 3000cfa for the night in total with use of a basic toilet and shower

name: Hotel Jardin D'Eden
description:
Hotel with lovely rooms but free camping on offer too for overlanding trucks

Able to camp for free in the car park in exchange for using the restaurant and bar. Beautiful beach, lovely pool, great owner. very nice indeed.

name: Ghana Embassy
description:
Border is officially closed but possible to enter, cross and exit:
(2 Dutch people with overland truck, entering from Ivory Coast.)
Fill in evisa saying you apply in Ivory Coast (does not work on phone). Bring copie of the form. 
Bring paper from ministry of internal affairs that allows you to exit Ivory Coast. 
Write letter to the ambassador to ask for permission to enter, cross and leave Ghana, with border crossings you want to take. Check your laisser passer if it’s ready. 
In evisa you can ask for a 4 day double transitvisa. You will only get 48 hours though. 
Cost 35.000 CFA 
Took us a week. They have express service. Not very easy to get it all done.

name: Border Cote D'Ivoire / Ghana
description:
Open from 6.30am to 6.30pm in August.

Busy border. March 2024 => Both sides for 2 people with Visa on arrival only 75 Min.
EDIT from another traveler: I came in April and it was very quick, only 15 min. But I was with an official bus. 

At the Ghanaian side, we were greeted at the entrance with the news that our car (righthand drive) would need to be escorted as it was illegal. Managed to get carnet stamped and this was not taken any further. 

Had a transit visa. Managed to get an emergency visa at the border on the spot for 150 dollars. ouch. 

Avoid if you don’t have a Carnet!!

name: Embassy of Liberia
description: Embassy of Liberia. Single entry visa for 1 month is 30,000 CFA, multiple entry visa for 3 months 60,000 CFA. 1 passport style photo and photocopy of first two pages of passport needed. 48 hour processing. Friendly staff.

name: Chez Jojo
description: Nice little spot in a relaxed bay, 50000 CFA for double room per night, good shower, has a restaurant and pet-friendly, lagoon next to the place

name: Embassy of Guinea (Conakry)
description: Multiple Entry Visa (3 months) for 70 000 CFA, one passport photo, hotel booking, copies of passport, Cotê d'Iviore visa and yellow fever vaccination were necessary. Pickup next day.

name: Hôtel de la Paix
description:
Hotel in the centre of Man. Rooms from 5000CFA. Parking and wifi available, restaurant under different management on site open from morning until late, meals from 1000CFA. Rooms downstairs are damp but have private bathrooms.

Unsure if camping in car is allowed as we came by bike.

name: Hôtel Grace
description:
Cross the square opposite  the water tower, cross tarred road behind and head down piste, first complex on the right. Hard to miss.

Rooms with bathroom from 5000CFA (still 05/2024). Secure parking available. No two people of the same gender in one room, even if only to reduce costs. Food stalls and several small restaurants and maquis nearby. Service somewhat absent but okay.

No car camping.

name: Cascade de Man
description:
Natural waterfall with swimming pool at its base. Admission 200CFA. Parking guards may charge more. Nice place, calm in the morning. 

Guides for La Dent de Man (8km walk) and Mt Tonkui (drive across piste and 3km walk) can be hired here. I went with Sherrif, pleasant company.

name: Le Brennus
description: Very nice French-owned hotel/bar/restaurant. Large secure parking. Rooms 30,000CFA, but we arrived late and got one for 25,000. Excellent restaurant, mains from 3,000-4,000 and up. Breakfast not included but available.

name: Garage La Difference
description: Typical African roadside garage, but this one is actually specialized in bigger bikes. Slightly pricier as a consequence, but this just may be the best place in Abidjan for overlanding bikes. All sorts of repairs and adjustments possible. Owner Ouatt is a nice fellow, can help with buying/selling bikes as well.

name: Parc Mont Péko
description: It is NOT an official park to visit, it is just a naturereservat for the animals. for the entry you need some autorisation papers & the hole park is military guarded.

name: Hotel Concorde
description:
Very nice, clean Hotel, paid 15000 CFA for a Double bed room
they even washed my car for free this morning :-)

name: Grimaldi Lines
description:
Very friendly and helpful staff here for car shipping. just make sure you already have a forwarder before you arrange the shipping here.
the forwarder they arrange is way too expensive!

name: Auberge Coki Plage
description:
Nice Hotel, Owner alowed us for camp here we paid 10'000 CFA per night.
we were 2 cars and the hotel was empty, so the owner provided us a room for using shower and toilet for free.

name: Nice Village with friendly locals
description:
It took a long time on the customs so we did not reach Man at day. We asked the "chief of village" if we can stay here. he allowed us to camp in front of his hut.

the whole time at least 20 locals where looking at us as they do not often see white people.

name: Diamond Shipping (mohaves)
description:
Very good shipping forwarder, they have very friendly, helpfull and english speaking staff there. The building doesn't look that good but the office is on the 3th floor. 
Make sure that you contact the forwarder first bevor the vessel.

name: little hotel for 4000cfa/room
description: Little bar/restaurant/hotel. cheap room for 4000cfa with own toilet/shower. no running water though, electricity via genwrator after 7-8pm.

name: La Dent de Man
description:
A beautiful hike, it is possible to make a circular hike passing a waterfall and right around the top (with a repeated steep section to the top).

You will have to deal with the Locals. You don’t really need a guide, but they will tell you, you have to get one. 

current fees:

2000cfa pp to hike Le Dent Du Man
1000cfa pp to go to the waterfalls
(if you do both is 3000cfa per person) 
1000cfa parking in the village

Local guide is negotiable round 15k.

Ask for Remi +2250564087209 he s
eems to be the manager of the place.

name: Village of Bougousa
description: Village to camp in. Asked to speak to the chief of the village, he was very accommodating and gave us food and water, and we camped directly infront of his house in the middle of town. Very, very friendly, absolutely zero privacy! An experience not to be missed. Ask and I'm sure they will say yes. We gave a little money in the morning - 3,000CFA - they tried to say no, and we insisted and it was well received.

name: Catholic Mission Tai
description: Father of the mission let us stay the night for free. Free food, shower, room, etc. He seemed nice, but at the mass in the morning it was all fire and brimstone and not so nice. Worked as a place to stay, but with strings attached.

name: Taï Forest Lodges
description:
Camping at the entrance to the National Park. Caretaker happy for us to camp here, but charged us 5,000CFA per night for two in a 4x4, and then entrance to the park (guided tour) was also very expensive. Amazing place, worth it in my opinion. Saw chimps extremely close up.
Call the caretaker when you arrive, or when you are back in town - 09742415 and he will organize a guide, etc.

There is a hotel with restaurant, etc, but I assume it's very expensive.
To get here, turn at the sign in town at N5.36.441, W7.28549
The North-South highway here was a nightmare of mud just after that rainy season - trucks stuck for a week, etc. Extremely strong 4x4 recommended.

name: Les Moutons de la Pizza
description: Cozy little restaurant with lagoon view. Lovely pizzas, really eccentric French owner. Not cheap though. 6000-8000 for a pizza depending on size and type. Recommended despite the price.

name: Auto parts in Yakro
description: Good selection of spare parts, also a workshop but only cars, for motorcycles they can point you to a mechanic elsewhere in town (haven't saved the waypoint). SKF bearings available here.

name: Auberge les 3 cocotiers
description: Lovely place by the beach. For a room they ask 20.000 XAF, which we cannot really afford. After some negotiations they let us pitch a tent at the sandy area just about 30 meters from the sea. Price was originally 7.000 for a night but we managed to negotiate it to 5.000 per night (1 tent, 2 people). Seems to be owned by a family which also lives here. Price for beer is 700, chicken with rice was 7.000 though (not sure how big it would be, instead we went to a local place few hundred meters east from here).

name: Hotel Siak
description: Rooms with Fan from 5000Cfa. Standard is ok, but I saw better places for that price. The Manager is nice though. I took a room, so not sure if camping is allowed, but space would be available.

name: Côté d'Ivoire Immigration
description:
No services but there are money changers floating around. Also a shop with drinks and snacks. No problems with immigration. 
Open 24/7.

name: Burkina Faso embassy Abidjan
description:
An unhelpful lady organises the visas. She can speak English. You need to knock on her office door and open it as she will not come out to check if anyone is waiting. 48,000 CFA, pick up next day. Requirements:
Two completed forms (no photocopy of one form) 
Two photos
Copy of passport
Copy of yellow fever certificate and sight original 
Printout of hotel booking

name: Residences MA
description: Cheap hotel, rough but has a comfy bed, air con, private bathroom, TV, kitchen with microwave and fridge, secure parking. Can also be booked on Bookings.com but is more expensive there. 15,000 CFA. Friendly reception and parking guard.  They even let an overlanding couple roof-tent in the parking lot for free when they arrived and it was full.

name: Carrefour
description:
Massive Carrefour in a mall (there is also a Burger King in the mall). 

You can park next to the entry without height limit. Good for bigger rigs

name: Don't know the name
description: OK Hotel. Secure parking. 12,000 CFA per double. No running water (but has a private bathroom with sit down toilet). Air con. Not a very comfy bed though. Friendly people. Satellite TV (only in French).

name: Le Zotah
description: We are staying here with our car with rooftent for 4000CFA per night. We can use the toilet and shower. The hotel is a bit old, the place needs restoration, but the facilities are good. There is running water. The owner is friendly. It is possible to rent a room from 6000 up to 12000CFA per night. The restaurant is not finished yet.

name: Hotel L'excellence
description: Nice hotel with view over a small mountain. We had diner (2500CFA per meal) and were able to camp here with our 4x4. They charged us 3000CFA for staying. We were able to shower in a room, which were also nice.

name: Chambre de Passage
description: Really simple place next to the road. They have rooms here to rent but we were allowed to camp here with our 4x4. Even though it is next to the road, when here, it feels like you are in the middle of the woods, surrounded with trees and plants. We payed 3000CFA for the night and got dinner and breakfast included.

name: ETS MN2H
description: It is a local shop with many spares for cars. We bought here our stabilization beam seals for our Toyota. 2000CFA per seal.

name: Dispensaire de Mahino
description: This is a clinic in the town of Mahino. The nurses warmly welcomed our request to pitch a tent here and even invited us into their home for a bucket bath. Later, one of them showed us around town to get the food. Super friendly! Pitched our tent on the veranda in their front lawn.

name: CI Customs at Niable
description:
They will ask for 50 000CFA for a 'Vignette Touristique' for your vehicle.

Entering Cote d'Ivoire is FREE, you do not need to pay even without a Carnet

If you have problems, call the Anti Corruption Unit in Cocody, Abidjan whilst with customs (ensure you get an Ivorian SIM card before you enter customs) 

ANTI CORRUPTION - +225 01 01 36 45 (ensure you keep the first ZERO)

name: Restaurant Alie-Fe
description: Fantastic restaurant on the corner of the street, well prepared & wonderfully presented Ivorian food at very good prices for Yamoussoukro (just over street food prices but a lot nicer).  Drinks are correctly priced too!

name: Laji
description:
Personally known for over a decade, used him last year for van that was driven down from Europe.  

Friend was also thrilled with his efficiency and price in August 2017 for a Land Rover.

No English but good body/mechanic noise language!!

Contact: +225 07 72 83 23 / +225 41 23 34 75

name: Hotel with no name
description:
Small quiet hotel, basic, bucket showers but for 4,000CFA worth the expense.  Can also probably arrange to camp in courtyard.

Quiet small maquis next door without food

name: Bureau des Douanes
description: Stamped my carnet ata with no problem. No request for Tourist Vignette.

name: Plage Lateko - Chez Perico
description: Place located next to the beautiful sandy beach with some places to sleep and a lot of space to camp on the grass. Good Orange network. Very friendly owner (he started with his brother Raymond who died in 2021). They can cook some excellent local food, take you on a trip to the river and are very helpful with other stuff. You need a good 4x4 to master the last couple of kilometres from Sassandra as the road is steep and not in a good condition. 3-5000cfa for 2 and a camping car.

name: Forest
description: Place located next to the road from Odienne to Manankoro. Lots of shade, possible to wildcamp. Not visible from the road.

name: Hôtel Amointrin (+ possibly camping)
description: Nice hotel with friendly staff. Rooms are quite clean and spacious enough for 2 persons. They come with AC and hot water. After some rough, hot sticky days on the road through Guinee with my girlfriend and our baby, this hotel felt like an oasis. The guard washed my car, not sure if he wanted money, but I tipped him anyway. Price was 16.000 CFA for a double (superior?) room. Laundry service available. For 1000 CFA I was able to refill my 40 liter watertank. Walled compound, secured with 24/7 guard and excellent views over the mountains. Not sure if one can sleep in their rooftent, but staff seemed flexibel enough to ask.

name: Sore Abdoylaye Mechanic
description: A friendly Mechanic who fixed some small problems quickly and for a good price. Was recommended to me by JoJo in Grand Bereby. 07958967 (french speaking) No sign on the building.

name: Mali Embassy
description:
No signs in the blue-tiled building called „Maison le Mali“.  
Walk to the end of the corridor on ground floor. Then go through the white, barred gate on the left of the end „square“ of the corridor. 
Take the first door to your left. 
The consul‘s secretary works behind the brown door just straight, right next to the couch where other applicants wait. 

There are copyshops in the building and around, in case you need it. People will show you. 

Very helpful people. One month multi-entry visa on the spot for 45,000 cfa for US passport.

name: Kimi Hotel
description: A well maintained hotel. Clean rooms, hot running water, strong AC. 20,000 for a double room with breakfast. Pleasant neighborhood. Traffic getting into the city wasn't too bad.

name: Hotel Aho
description: Went here because all the other places were full, pretty unfriendly staff. 25000 for double room but with only one included breakfast. Would not recommend, but wifi is good and rooms are nice, so ok if the rest is full.

name: Niega
description: Lovely little village called Niega, stunning beach and lagoon. Road is an easy dirt track (at least in the dry season). For me, most beautiful and peaceful spot in CI. Warm welcome by the village elder, excellent place to wild camp (ask first :) really nice place!

name: Rip Curl Surf Camp
description: Just next to Hotel Jardin d’Eden. Extensive grounds, swimming pool, soccer field, huge restaurant & bar at the beach. Rooms are really expensive (40 000 - 65 000 on weekdays, more expensive on weekends) but they might allow camping in return for eating in the restaurant. Food and the whole place are much nicer than Eden, same prices. We loved the Poulet Braisé with French fries (10 000 cfa, enough for 2 if you’re not super hungry). Owned by 3 Lebanese surfers in their 30’s. Downsides: no WiFi, food & drinks relatively expensive as everywhere at beachfront properties in Assinie.

name: Petron Campsite
description: Informal Campsite, no facilities, just camping in front of the sea. 3 guardians. Secure

name: Hotel Sonia
description:
Looks like a pretty good budget hotel at first. 6000CFA for room with fan, 10.000CFA for room with airco. No Wifi. Hotel owner was so drunk he didn’t seem to be able to speak French anymore. Bed in one of the rooms was used/dirty. Had to ask for new sheets 5 times before he seemed to understand and got some “fresh” sheets. We had to pull him out of the bar to do so.

Matrasses are pretty good, all rooms with private bath.

name: Deserted Beach Village
description:
The prices are not what other travelers have reported.  Be careful please. 
The real prices are :
7000 cfa per person for a room
6000 cfa per person with a campervan
5000 cfa per person for tent
And you add 1000 cfa per person just for entry. 
The guy who works here is Vivien (not the boss
His number is : +225 07 58 381 688
He can cook for you, if you want. 
But, please, you have to negotiate before you park. 
Found this place randomly in the wilderness, since we wanted to save money for lodges or camps. Easily the most beautiful place in the Ivory Coast so far... and here are many beautiful places.  There’s some houses but nobody lives here. Two locals joined after we arrived but went off after some explanation from us. One came back later to bring us some coconuts.

name: Abidjan
description: Residence la Villa, second Plateaux, Abidjan , Cocody second Plateaux  Vallon 12 Arrondissement. Phone +225 07571878 or +225 22522918 e-mail: Serge.Clemente83@gmail.com  it is private residence with five rooms from cfa 20 000 to 30 000. Clean, nice staff, big rooms. Kitchen, Pool, big safe parking. Next to Ghana, Togo, Benin Embassy .

name: Police and Customs Check IC
description:
Border post for Ivory Coast to Liberia. Road from Toulepleu to the border is a motorbike track. Road from Toulepleu to Blolequin is tarred, many potholes and missing sections to Guiglo

Watch out for the stamp on the cdp. obligation to go and stamp in Zwedru. not possible on the border

Road not practicable in the rainy season

name: Customs Ivory Coast.....
description:
U should do you customer latest here or ask where the boss is. No one doing at border. 
Ivory Cost customs

name: Chez Michel
description:
UPDATE 2022 : Toilets are dirty and shower doesn't exist. The owner seems to have a problem with alcohol and he is impolite.

Very nice place where you can stay with your 4x4 with a wonderful view to the beach. Owner is very friendly. he prepares a really good fish (10000 cfa for 2 people, good portions). you can also sleep in a small hut, but we didn't look at it. there are two basic toilets and a bucket shower. Price 5000 cfa per night for 2 persons and a 4x4.

name: Hotel Bassama
description:
Basic facilities, Nice location just outside the town. Nice viewpoint and quiet surroundings. 6 rooms, camping possible, Nice staff. 5000 CFA per night.
tel 05579441/85945300

name: Hotel Koral Beach
description: Nice hotel. Room from 30‘000-40‘000 incl breakfast. On sunday they have a big brunch buffet. Food is good but better and cheaper in la case bleue.

name: melya plage
description:
Direct at the beach, under palm-tree. 
 Nobody disturbed us.

name: Kame Surf Camp & School
description: Pretty nice hotel with ten rooms, a very cozy beach bar and an own high ropse course. The owner, called Kame, is a French man who was born in the Ivory Coast. Very nice and friendly atmosphere. You can feel, that Kame does his business with Love.

name: Spot to stay overnight
description: Looks like a place where they get the gravel for the road. Lots of space, not visible from the road. No one was coming by. But it is right next to the road and the entrance is big and good visible, so maybe sometimes there are people coming by. Not many vehicle-tracks here though.

name: Difficult Road
description:
The north-south highway is partly extremely muddy. At least in rainy season. With a bike you can usually go around the big holes, but with cars... Better bring a good 4X4 with a winch and shovels and everything, there are not many cars on the road to help you out. Coming from the  north, it seems alright first but be aware, it gets worse.
There also was a broken down bridge. With bikes and smaller cars you can use a little wooden bridge. Big rigs propably have to turn around here. I don't have the exact position but it was quite a bit north of the national park entrance.

name: Bureau de Douane Man
description: This is the place where you can get the Vignette Touristique (laisser passer for Europeans)  if you do not have a carnet. They wanted to charge 17000 CFA at first, but it should be for free, don’t pay. They were surprised that we came without escort from the Gbapleu border. At that border the douane tried to make us pay for the escort but we refused and said we would find our way to Man by ourselves. When entering the douane grounds in Man, go to the first door on the left, about 50 meters from the entrance gate. There you will find the man in charge. We made some calls to Abidjan douane to finally get it, so be prepared to put some effort to get it for free.

name: Assiny Palms
description:
Restaurant and Hotel, steep downhill entrance off the main road.

Probably the best hotel deal in town currently, beautiful rooms for 15,000CFA with plenty of parking.

Fantastic food here too, shaded by literally hundreds of palms it's very laid back with good Ivorian dishes, slightly more expensive than others in town but very worthwhile

name: Hotel Gbaoly
description: Rooms with fan and private bathroom starting from 5000 cfa, possibility to park the bike/car inside

name: Tourist Information - National Park Taï
description:
Here it's possible to have info and organize excursions in the park to see monkeys.

Check the website for all the details and prices: 
https://ecotourismetai.com 

They accept payments only in cfa, the nearest bank with an atm is in Guiglo, 80km north of dirt track. They seem to also accept Orange Money.

name: Auberge Beau Sejour
description: Hotel in Taï, rooms with private bathroom 6000 cfa

name: Hotel Pacha
description:
Private basic room with "private" bucket shower.  Shared pit toilet. 
Secure parking for car/bike, not sure for big rigs. 3000cfa, kind owner, there is a sign in the main road.

name: Corrupt checkpoint
description: Said that the cedeao insurance can't be written by pen :) don't pay, just wait and they let you go

name: Embassy of Nigeria
description: Not possible to apply for a touristic visa unless you are a resident in Ivory Coast

name: Centre Bethanie
description: The place is owned by the bishop of Man. It s located on a small mountain just outside the city (2 km from the center) in a beautiful and peaceful location. Dorms are available (2000 to 3009 FCFA) as well as private rooms (from 5000 up to 10,000). Clean rooms with ensuite shower, outdoor public toilets. Breakfast is 1000 FCFA. Lunch/dinner, 1500 FCFA.

name: Best of Plage
description:
Really nice and quiet place with lovely bay to swim, surf or fish in sea or laguna. 
There is no more hotel but this place is still maintained by village people. It’s very clean even it’s basic. 
Some fishermen are there so you can ask for crayfish and fish, they will be able to provide you. 
You can contact Hubert Dagbego, us before arrive, who is in charge to maintain the site and keep it clean
His phone number : 225 05218815
Chef Dagbego plage: 225 06620121

name: Adama, Mechanics for Big Rigs
description:
Adama is specialized in trucks and was farmiliar with our Mercedes Unimog. He is super reliable and helpful, works quick and takes some time to listen and explain. He has good electricians at hand too and does not hesitate to help with any other issue. We spent two nights parked in his garage for free feeling safe as supervised by a guard. 
We definitely recommend the place for all trucks and Unimogs! 
He speaks perfect French, no Englisch. 
Tel: ‭05 95 93 38‬

name: Total Station with camping facilities for trucks
description:
Big parking for truckers to spend the night. Secured by a guard, shower and toilet available. We slept in the car, tent camping might be possible on the grass. Petrol station is open 24/7. Tidy, clean and modern place.
Shop has cold drinks, little speed restaurant offers local food. 
Super friendly staff!! 
500 to 1000 FCFA tip for guard appropriate.

name: No name
description: It's a small place with very basic rooms. but there is a fan and a private bathroom with shower and running water at anytime! They were very friendly and I also found it a good place to wash my clothes since there is a backyard with plenty of sunlight. After negotiating I paid 3000 CFA/night for the room.

name: Auberge de Kong
description: This is currently the only formal option for lodging in Kong. A standard room costs 15000 CFA/night, which is expensive comparing to what you may find in bigger cities for basic hotels. But for the same room amenities you would pay more in other cities. I tried for a long time to negotiate camping there (with a tent) but it was the night before local elections. There is also a shared toilet with shower in the common area and a restaurant with quiet a lot of options (local and continental) for a reasonable price (considering it's a hotel).

name: Ange Shemaria
description: Decent place that sells pastries, ice cream, hamburger and local dishes (alloco, attieke, chicken...). 1 croissant for 300CFA.

name: Homan du Pont (Homan 3)
description: Hotel with simple amenities 5 min drive from the city center (market and Rue des Banques). I paid 5000cfa/night for a room with a double bed and private bathroom. There is enough space to camp with a tent, but because elections are going on today they didn't like the idea.

name: La Flotte
description:
Nice place to stay right on seashore with beautiful view. Restaurant to test local and Italian food. 
Nice room from 35000 to 60000cfa for 2. Swimming pool, and possibility for many excursions. 
Safe guarded parking in the yard. 
Wifi in main building.

name: Immigration
description: One village before real border. No problem, quick immigration process.

name: Sport3
description: Great bicycle shop. Very kind and professional. They have lot of spare parts from Europe.

name: Internet and copy Shop
description:
Internet and copy shop that are very helpful and close to Ghana embassy (800 m) 

Print 150
4 pictures 2.000
Copy 50

name: Hotel Foundara
description: Hotel with restaurant and cold beers. Private parking. Double rooms with AC and bathroom for 10500 CFA for 2 persons. also more luxurous rooms available.

name: Hotel Residance Ben
description:
Budget hotel. Promotion advertises for 13000cfa a night but never available. Double for 20000cfa with kitchen with just a few tools.
Secure compound for cars and bikes.
Not sure about big rigs
Don’t speak English but the watchman is from Ghana and translated for me.
Across the road from Doracille a local play area. Doraville painted with big letters on the wall.

name: Le Kara Krou Chez Gus
description:
Ecolodge in front of a beautiful and clean beach managed by Gus, an Italian man living there since 8 years knowing all secrets of the area.
Great food at affordable price (10.000cfa for a complete meal) and campsite at 8.000cfa/night for 2 persons with car/van/tent.
Special of the house: grilled lobster and pasta with shrimps.
Bungalow available at 25.000cfa/night

name: Auberge de Mahino
description: Basic room with bucket shower. Very friendly after a hard day on the bikes. 4000 CFA Per Room

name: Centre d'accueil Sainte Famille
description: The nuns here have lots of clean rooms with good shower and fan for 10000cfa. Safe parking.

name: Hotel Residence Moahe
description: Very Clean Hotel just off A5. Large double room with dining and sitting area. TV. Good shower. Lady asked 25,000 CFA but I told her it’s outside my budget and we agreed on CFA12,000

name: Amarily Lodge
description:
Expensive at 45000, but got a discount to 30000 cfa - still expensive, and the food is too. 
However the room is great & it’s location is really peaceful.  It has only been open 6 months so everything works. 
Small pool & terrace overlooking the beach & sea. 
If you don’t mind the price it might be worth a look in. There are a few other places next door but they were not prepared to negotiate.

name: Next to cotton fields
description: Follow the track that leaves road B303 at 7.90910, -6.12606. The wild camping location is next to some trees and at the edge of a cotton field. The track goes further and branches in other directions too, so I reckon there are more places to camp around here. There is a village close by to the South. Very weak mobile phone signal (Orange).

name: Forest
description: Leave the A3 road on track to reach this place. The track goes further and branches in different directions, so I reckon there are more places to wild camp here. Sap is being collected from the trees in this forest, but I saw no one when I stayed for one night. It's well hidden from the road. No mobile phone signal here (Orange).

name: Espace Concorde Amitie
description: A bar. You can easily park a van or camping car for the night. it's on the border of a little lake. We had shade. 3000cfa for 1 night in tent, rooms for 15000 to 25000cfa/night.

name: Hotel de la paix
description: Verry basic hostel for pass 1night. Room for 5000-8000 or 10000cfa with clim n private bathroom. u can't put the tent, owner don't like that. it's the cheaper place in Issia!

name: Overnighting spot by the river
description: Hidden quite road with turning possibly at the end by the Bandama River between banana plants and someone's tomato garden. We sleep here on our way to Man.

name: Hotel La Bahia
description: We parked in front of the hotel and we could use it's beach and facilities in charge of getting a drink in the bar. The owner loves overlanding himself and he was really friendly and welcoming.

name: Wild camping on the beach
description:
Completely hidden from the road where we had our own private beach. Bars and restaurants along the street.

About 3km to west there is a village by the lagoon with friendly, welcoming locals. Definitely worth a visit.

name: Manankoro border
description:
On the Ivorian side they don't have proper customs or Duane. You get stamped in your passport after multiple check points in about 15 km. Everyone was really chilled and surprised that we drove that difficult road.

Organizing carnet de passage or vignette touristic is possible in Man.

name: Hotel Beau Sèjour
description:
Although it officially opens in February 2019 we could park in their garden and use the shower of one of the hut's.

It's in a really good location a bit out of the busy town and 3 km from one of the cascades. There is a Boulangerie and a bar across.

name: CACOMIAF
description: Found decent motorcycle engine oil (Motul) and motorcycle tyres (Pirelli) here. Bought Motul engine oil, and it was expensive. Didn't buy tyres but noticed they had tyres suitable for dirt and road. Worth checking out if you're looking for motorcycle engine oil other than what's on sale in fuel stations.

name: After Work
description: Nice rooftop restaurant with cold beers and good food for reasonable prices. Demi Poulet is good. they also serve fish

name: Vanessa
description: Simple but lovely open-air place with delicious fish (poisson) plates and really big 1 liter beer bottles (Bock) if you like. Not expensive

name: Eco Bank
description:
In this area there are a few banks.  This one has ATM, WU and change services, but get here early or you will wait hours!
ATM without fees.

name: Costume Museum
description: Interesting stop and great place to pick up some gifts.  Entry 1000CFA

name: Maya hôtel
description:
Pretty descent for a short stay 
Rooms start at 8000 FCFA to 12.000 FCFA 
Air conditioning

name: Maquis Les appatames
description:
Maquis locale food , very good environment. 
Outdoors sitting , or indoors , private entrance . Really good local food without the loud sound around !

name: The Adress
description:
Great hotel with A/C 
Showers with hot water 
Close to practically everything 
Cleans are very clean 
Staff very friendly 
Price are very good for the quality of the rooms

name: Forest clearing
description: Behind trees not far from the road. Good wild camp easily accessible from the paved high way.

name: Camping 4x4 Nomaden
description: Really nice shady campsite amongst the trees next to a quiet, clean and beautiful beach run by Germans from november until april every year. 5000cfa for camping per person. Cold beer and some groceries available. Water from a well, toilet and simple bucket shower.

name: Hôtel Zara
description:
Very clean rooms 
Very good prices for a short stay 
6000 FCFA /night room with fan 
10.000 FCFA / night with air conditioned 
We checked our 3 hotels and it was the best and newest in town 
It has a restaurant on site and also goods available to buy in the room !

name: O’bali
description:
Excellent food 
Prices are very reasonable for the quality 
Clean and staff are very professional and friendly

name: La Villa
description: Glacier / restaurant / pizzeria / ice cream / chawarma. Lebanese food, No aircon.

name: Hôtel chigata
description:
Descent hotel for comfort 
Prices are 12.000 FCFA for single bed with AC / bathroom /hot shower 
18.000 FCFA queen size bed 
Clean hotel / safe location 
Staff very friendly 
You can negotiate

name: Iman’s Hotel
description:
Excellent hotel - actually the best in town 
Very clean, Comfortable, Pool access included, Secured in good area, Peaceful and quiet

name: Restaurant chez Paye
description:
Really good food 
Senegalese food and local but high standard

name: Immigration
description: Friendly guys, kinda take their time, about half an hour to 45 minutes. Not sure about customs as I didn't have a TIP for Cote d'Ivoire,  but an officer at the duoane in a town about 20km from the border indicated you do the paperwork at the border.

name: Under coconut tree
description:
Very nice place in front the sea and behind the coconut trees. Nobody asked us money. Very quiet place without children. 
---
Beach is directly in front of us, car set up about 10m before the beach underneath coconut trees. There’s a bit of rubbish near the beach hence why we’ve set up camp a bit behind. Waves are quite ferocious so no swimming unfortunately. Beware of coconuts falling!! We had a near-miss last night.

name: Palm plantation
description:
UPDATE 2022:

Now this is a private plantation with an office. Palm and hevea plantations. But there is no problem to stay for the night for free. There is a friendly security officer and it's very quiet.
No commodities.
Hidden from the road.

name: Hotel Canaan
description: Rooms with fan for 6.000 CFA, with a/c for 12.000 CFA. The rooms are big and nicely done. No fridge and there was supposed to be running water but we never saw it, had to use buckets.

name: Customs (Douane) Côte d'Ivoire
description: Yellow building with CDI flag. They will stamp your carnet if you have one.

name: Village of peace by Stephane and Stclaire
description: The owner of this place is Stefan and he is living on the beach. He is very welcoming to everybody and likes to make new connections. We had really nice discussion with him and his friends who always come around. It is like a basic place but really beautiful

name: Residence Belle Vue
description: We booked via Expedia and paid 23€ for 2 people for an entire apartment with kitchen, dining room, bathroom and a small patio. A/c, hot water, fridge, microwave, stove, oven and breakfast included! Just great. Only downside was the WiFi didn't reach into the room and you could feel the springs in the mattress, but we loved it. Supermarket just next to it, taxis to the embassies for about 2.000 CFA. Check the price before on Booking or Expedia (cheaper) because I think they change quite often. This is the right location, not one of the two that Google maps show! Enjoy!

name: James Burger
description: Nice place for motorbikers who need to meet other bikers and to have some help for hosting and mechanical problems . Ask Jamal +2250708101023 . 1000 CFA franc to wash the bike. Every day at 5 pm the biker club of Abidjan is here .

name: Centre Focolari
description:
The Focolari Centre offers:
- comfortable and clean rooms
- and also welcomes motorhomes.
Very nice home in a beautiful site.

Plenty of room in peaceful gardens with shade for campers with tents, rooftop tents or a camper. Clean toilet and a proper shower.

name: La Nouvelle Paillote à Grand Bassam
description: Nice place to chill for a few days. Asking 35k for AC rooms but we talked down to 20k. Food service super slow and pricey but walk up the road near the schools for lunch dinner buy from town markets. Great parking for motorcycles and vehicles.

name: Auberge Akwaba
description:
hotel restaurant in a pleasant setting
but very unwelcoming for travelers with vehicle.
Very large guarded parking.
No bivouac possible in his vehicle. Mandatory room.

Prices are based on skin color.
so very expensive for Europeans.
To avoid.

name: Katakie
description: this is a bar run by the super friendly petit poisson. you can park your car here for free and camp there. super cosy and very beatiful place.

name: gabon embassy
description:
1 photo + hotel booking (I think it was optional). 
No insurance, no vaccination certificates, no photocopies etc... 
35,000 tourist visa 1 month. got mine in 1 day (usually is 2 days I was told).
easy going, nice staff

name: Hotel Nôkii Pirê
description:
Hotel close to a Bar. 5000CFA
9000CFA with aircon

name: Orange Mobile
description: Good place to buy local SIM card and credit/data.  Secure parking. 200 CFA for SIM card.

name: 4x4 Off-Road CI
description: The only shop in Cote D’Ivoire that specialises in 4x4 off-road parts, mechanics and camping gear. We are getting a custom-made shelf put in our car so we can access the fridge more easily. Ahmed and his wife are so lovely. Work started immediately on our car and will be done within 30 minutes to an hour. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

name: Tabaoule Ecolodge
description:
Lovely place, beautiful beach. Good food.  Plenty of shaded areas to park. 
A bar with cold beers. Run by a great guy JP
Unfortunately a bit expensive. Camping for 15000 cfa (may be able to negotiate this, we managed to stay for 5000 cfa)
Rooms available from 30000 - 55000 cfa
Food approx 9000 cfa (fresh grilled fish, rice)

Nighttime entertainment with some guys playing djembe, forest walks (the place is next to a protected forest), natural pools, hammocks, kayaks, paddle boards and snorkeling available. 

Has a great relaxed vibe, stayed for 3 nights, will probably come back again.

name: Toyota Abidjan
description: The official Toyota dealer of Abidjan with an Express service... don’t go there. We needed an oil change for our LandCruiser. Lots of paperwork, tried to let us sign without any preliminary info for a full fetch service maintenance. No information on there planning, took us 5 hours (!) to get this simple job done. Very fancy office/workshop, horrible service! You are not allowed to enter the workshop while the mechanic is working on your car. They have a huge stock of spare parts; if you need only an original Toyota part, this is probably the place to be.

name: Michelin/BF Goodrich
description: If you need new BF Goodrich or Michelin tyres or repair for your car/truck this is the place to be. They repaired for us two holes in one tyre for 5.000 CFA. Friendly people and good and fast service!

name: better than nothing
description: place to sleep 50m off the road. small path which is used to get cacao bags to the road. really last option but helped us out for one night.

name: Tika Beach
description: small but beautiful beach. wild camping, parking right next to beach. before reaching the village Tika turn left and follow road approx.  1500m. beach IS at the end of a short, steep descent. locals come on Sundays, mostly deserted during the week

name: QUAI40
description: small, cost hotel. 5 rooms in 40ft containers, mostly business. very clean, breakfast, showers, pool. very nice french owner, let us sleep in enclosed car lot for 40'000cfa. yes, Abidjan is expensive.

name: Residence Sisana
description: We stayed here four nights in a very nice appartment. Living room with AC, kitchen with gas for cooking and dishes+tableware, bathroom with hot water and bedroom with also AC. Every evening some music on the street, but very quiet during the night/morning. Car was parked on the street in front of the building, but camera guarded day and night by two guards. Very friendly and helpfull owner/concierge. After two nights the whole appartment was cleaned and we got new bed sheets. Pressing and boulanger nearby. We negotiated an appartment in the back (not at the street side) down form 30.000 to 25.000.

name: Salads & Sun
description:
Great Restaurant for Burgers, Tajine, Spare Rips, ...

Very nice atmosphere.

Probably the best Chicken Burger i had in my life. CFA3500

name: Immigration and Douane Cote d Ivoire
description: Here they check visa and laisser passer. if current is working this is the only place where they can issue a vignette touristique directly without escort to Man. very friendly people. when we came the new police office had been destroyed, so they couldnt stamp in our passports. they let us go to Biankouma police station and have our passports stamp there. beware that the road to and from border is very bad. 40 km Lola to Sipilou and 60km from Sipilou to tarmac road. In between earth road and in the beginning of rain time already in very bad condition. so do only if you have no carnet and expect trouble with douane.

name: at the river
description: next to Soubré and road, but absolutely quiet and nice view.

name: Ivoire hotel
description: Hotel with secure parking. Rooms 12000 -15000. Restaurant secure. Can park campers but no camping.

name: Berah residence
description: Hotel with pool. Bikes, 4x4 and even our big rig fitted. Friendly people helpful. Safe parking. Rooms or sleep in camper.

name: hotel Rocher
description: Friendly hotel with plenty place for 20 landcruisers an even 2 or 3 big rigs. Rooms or bungalow? No problem. Restaurant, bar, WiFi, dogs outside but not in the hotel itself. Coming from Ghana cross the bridge direction Abidjan for approx 1,5 km. Signposted to the right. Sleep in/ on top off your camper no problem.

name: palm plantation
description:
emergency stop for 1 night in the field of a palm plantation. 
far from the road, nobody sees you. nobody came around, very quiet. 
also big cars will fit.

name: By the river
description: Hidden place on red soil next to the road. good for one night. no scenic view but quiet. No orange reception.

name: Hotel Harmonie
description: Motel style, large parking. Across from police station. Pretty run down but low prices. 6000cfa for a fan room, AC rooms available

name: As green as it gets
description: End of village, some people working around in distance. Wanted to drive all the way to the lake but ended up here because this road ended. Some little flat pieces of ground. Talked to some adults and they approved us camping here. Good thing that people leave you alone just after dark. next they though people told us we didn't ask permission to the village chief. went there, talked and it was all okay. I suggest talk to chief before sleeping

name: Hotel Fondy
description:
Normal price for a room is 15,000 CFA, Aircon double room (standard), WiFi signal is strong. Price does not include breakfast, but I negotiated it to include breakfast. 

Safe parking in a quiet area. There is a pool, but it was closed when I was here.

name: Corrupt police
description: Corrupt police, our friends were pulled earlier in the day, we were pulled few hours later. Police told both of us we were doing 126kmh, we were doing under 70 kmh. Gave up pretty quick when we said this was impossible.

name: Duekoue
description: This is a parts store with a lovely gentleman who works behind the counter. He will help you with parts, and was able to fashion a wheel hub for a broken landrovers discovery 2 with his metal work colleagues down the road. Recommend.

name: Dream beach at Dogbalé
description:
Behind the village there is a nice beach under palm trees. Ask in the village for Prince or Anthony. They will show you the place for the tent. In addition they also cook very well. We only paid for the food. Maybe they want some money for the camp spot - ask in advance!
There is a small shop with fresh bread and it is also possible to get a bucket shower in the village.

name: Hotel CAA
description:
Private rooms, with bathroom, TV, towels, toilet paper and soap.
The price for a room with AC is 20,000 per night.
The place is clean, proper, safe (CCTV) and really well-located, 10min to the Gare Routiere, next to Grand Marche.

name: School
description: Up the hill of this village, there is a school. When you ask nicely if you may set up your tent in the school, they allow it. It's a clean school for African standards, and if you ask they might give you a bucket shower.

name: hotel zenith
description: hotel just as many hotels are in Africa. price is 5000 cfa for a room without television.

name: Hôtel mon Afriq
description: Superb place. a lot of vegetation. a beautiful pool and a small park with wild animals in freedom.

name: in the forest
description: turn from the main road into a dirt road going into an artificial forest with palm trees. Then turn again right and hide yourself after a trees. In the evening/at night we were alone. In the morning few locals on bikes passed but didn't even stop. All was fine. But better to wake up early. The road from A3 to Divo is very good, new tarmac.

name: Big place surrounded by trees
description:
Its a place that have been probably used in time when they were building the main road.
Now it's empty
It's full of children if you come.
After children the man came here and we asked about permision. It's ok to stay here. He took children with him for a while.

name: Lac d‘Ayamé
description: Next to the lake where you can fish, make fire and wash your clothes. Enough place for big cars. No one is living near this place, it’s quiet.

name: Gendarmerie
description: They stop you to tell their boss that you are at the road and let you wait. Just wait and say nothing then you can go after a while.

name: Siloe clinic, Grand Bassam
description:
best place for your Malaria treatment. They know what they do. 
Blood test: 3.500,- CFA
Doc consultation: 7.000,- CFA
Malaria falciparum/ Malaria Tropicana 
3 injections within 3 days worked out perfect!! Or you decide to take the pills instead of injections. After 3 more days waiting, the do an other blood test to be sure all the parasites are gone.

name: Hambol hotel Katiola
description: Very good hotel. Western style. Clean bed and toilet. Swimming pool. Good restaurant. Safe choice on the way to Bouake. 30.000 CFA for a double room. Negotiated to fit 2 adults and 2 children.

name: Routeside
description: Next to the street on the left. Quiet at night but busy in the morning from 6:30 on.

name: Berges du lac de Kossou
description: Directly to the lake very quiet and a great view (also find it on google maps). There is a little gare for tiny ships and a village (only 4-5 houses) behind the trees with some pigs. Only the kids visit us shortly.

name: Old landing strip
description: This is an old and unused runway where you are totally alone. On the way there is a lot of dust but when you arrive at the runway you can find clean place.

name: Mosque at Kong
description:
Mosque made of Clay...
Very interesting history of the Kong empire. Close to unbelievable when seeing today’s town of Kong.

name: Orange SIM card
description:
This is where get an Orange SIM card. The guy speaks English very well. 
A money changer is nearby, where you can get rid of your guinea francs.

ATTENTION:
Read the comments! It is sometimes a strange procedure and perhaps they want to make more money with tourists.

name: Hotel Nimba / Danane
description:
Fally is a very nice lady! She invited us to her hotel. 
Room with AC private bathroom, shower. 15000CFA per night. 
08765374

name: Summit on Mont Tonkpi
description:
Amazing 360° views on the summit.
At the top there are keepers of the antenna, you can ask them to go up. It's 75m high over the forest. They were super friendly we offered them a bier.
It's an easy road track to go. 
People before the waterfall (parking area) ask 500 CFA per car to go on this road.

name: Wildcamp near Mont Tonpki
description:
Flat area next to the track, close to abandoned buildings.
Super quiet place. We saw no-one.

name: Wildcamp between Yamkro and Abidjan
description:
Super quiet place at 6km from the exit of the highway.
We saw someone on a bike, he just said hello.
Close to granite boulders.
UPDATE : It's seems this place is a touristic place where you need a guide...
Maybe the better option is to take the road 1km after the village (you can see it on the satellite images of Osmand or Google map) instead of the road close to the village.

name: Camp in primary school
description: I was able to camp inside the primary school without any problem. I had dinner with the director, his wife and two children, and was later invited to a teacher who speaks English very well. they even provided a bucket shower for me. lovely people. if you visit them, say hi to them from Bas.

name: Food court
description: Beer garden with grilled chicken and fish

name: Hôtel Royaume
description:
A European standard hotel with closed gate parking and securities. 
Start from 20,000 with AC and private bathroom with warm shower. 
Food court walking distance. 
Good stop before or after border crossing.

name: school camp
description:
I was able to camp under the roof of this school after asking a few men, who brought me to the chief. very friendly people. they also gave me bananas and a bucket of water. 

MODERATOR NOTE: Please check local and country laws to confirm camping is allowed in this area.

name: Soko-Sampa border crossing
description: Easy border crossing. On the side of Ivory Coast they stamped my passport and let me go after 5 minutes. Then cycling 4 km to the Ghana checkpoint. Usually this should be easy too, only problem I had was because I have two Dutch passports which confused them.

name: Roc village (on the beach)
description: you can park directly on the beach (for the beautiful view) and under the coconut trees (for the shadow).amazing beach where we stayed 5 nights, totally desert and beautiful. you are surrouded by the village so kids and adults come to visit you. it is not every time quiet but they are very friendly, offering us fresh coconut, songs and interesting advices. you can also see turtles on the beach during the night at 500 meters when it is the nest season.it is free, just they would like some clothes or that you consume in the village (bar and food avalaible). water tap avalaible in the village and one very very small shop so come with your staff. for 4*4 or small vans because the way is small, sandy and under the coconut trees ! the only problem : no toilets :-(

name: Wild camp on the beach
description: In a small village, nice place on the beach and under the coconut trees. Good to swim. Free place. Nice before or after Liberia!

name: Riverside
description: very nice place run by a family. it is free to park,they dont ask nothing but if you want, you can eat in the restaurant (1000fcfa a plate) or drink a fresh beer (600fcfa). nice view : in front of the river and a small pier. very friendly people, we loved it! no toilets but bucket shower available.

name: Cameroon Embassy
description:
This is the new location, you can’t find it on Google. (Sept. 2022)
Wrong location in Google.

name: Beside a track in a coffee plantation
description: We pulled off the main road (which is in places awesome new tar and in places muddy diversions) just north of here, followed the track into the woods and turned right at a T-junction, we were able to pull off the track without damaging any of the trees (we think they are coffee trees/bushes!) Arrived about 6pm and didn't see or hear anyone.

name: Basilica of Our Lady of Peace
description:
Giant church, by some measurements the biggest in the world. Built in the 80s at a cost of around $300 million USD.

The official fee is 2000CFA entrance for foreigners.
Bring ID for registration!

name: Awesome parts place
description:
Having been trying to find the wheel bearings for our 4x4 sprinter (non standard and a pain in the bum) for a while. Was sent here from the other parts place and the man in the shed sorted what we needed! He kept leaving (presumably to go to another shop!) but he found them all!

We went to the little shop to the left of the pile of tires!

The name is: Sidibe Yacouba
Number: +225 05801269 (he speaks little English but Google translate)

name: Port Royal bar
description:
Great view of the city from the water front, busy at the weekends.

650ml Bock beers for 600CFA (buy 3 for the price of 2 when we were here making it the cheapest beer so far in Ivory Coast!)

name: Compound full of cars/ garage
description: We asked at Ben's residence if we could  pay to park in their compound as they had no rooms. They said no but the helpful (English speaking) watchan put us in touch we a guy who runs an Africa garage/ breakers yard/ compound just down the way. It is just a compound full of cars in various states of disrepair but it has a big wall locked gates and people always around.We paid 5000CFA total for two nights to stay in our camapervab. Not beautiful but cheap enough and convenient for embassys. We used taxis to get about for 1500cfa. The chapa who runs the place, Salam, gave us his phone number 03750412 (Salam speaks only french).

name: Togo consulate
description:
We came here to enquire about getting a visa. We could get one for 1 month but the cost is 25000cfa so we didn't bother having read we could get a VOA for 10000cfa for 7days at the boarder and then get it extended to a month - hope the iOverlander posts that suggest this are accurate!

(British passport holders)

name: Benin Embassy
description: Not possible to get tourist visa, advised to either get a VOA (1 week, 10000cfa) at boarder or  an e-Visa (looking at other posts on ioverlander it seems this is 30days and 30000 CFA). We are going to get the VOA and try and work out if we can extend it later...

name: Clearing off the road in rolling hills
description:
Quiet road, not completely hidden but hardly any traffic and hidden enough once dark. Down the hill there is an army training centre and some road construction (road had trucks the following day). We believe the ground has been cleared for some housing development but given the number of half finished developments in the area this isn't going to be any time soon! 

There are some nice sandy trails fro a bike ride the next day and we were about to leave our campervan here to go check them out (see 'Trailforks' app for bike routes, but be aware they are actually just double tracks, beautiful views but nothing special riding wise!)

name: Ferry (across Lagoon)
description:
To access the sandy tracksand rolling hills-which were full of wild camping possibilities!

It was free and had space for 6 big 4x4 or a couple of trucks at a time. Good ferry, not sure of times but we waiting about 30 minutes with 2 other cars going south.

name: Coucoue Lodge
description: very nice place between the lagoon and the sea.

name: Maquis-Resto-Bar
description:
The restaurant is next to the road right on a small lake, where you can swim and wash. Camping in the parking in front of the restaurant is possible, if you consume in the restaurant. Cold beer and other drinks as well as good food available. 
People are nice and friendly.

name: On a small lake
description: Nice place right on a small lake where you can swim and wash. Beautiful landscape but no shade here. Nobody is around, it's very quiet. We stayed here for two nights and highly recommend the place.

name: Drogba Beach
description: Owner let us park truck in car park for 5 days while waiting for visa's, 3 Euro a night, use of toilets and bucket showers, night security. Right on the beach, very busy restaurant as best food and value for money. Friendly staff and cheap cold beer!!!

name: camp on the beach
description: Nice spot for wild camping directly on the beach between some palm trees and a few small broken down houses. Peach full spot, only some nice dogs were visiting us.

name: Garage PAGANI - Inter Parebrise
description:
Quick service, they have resin (résine) to repair windshield (pare-brise), just impacts.
Nice staff, like in reception call.
Near airport.
Tel: 21 36 02 24

name: Church Parking
description: Paroisse Notre Dame de la Paix d’Oupoyo. Large Catholic Church with large grounds and large entrance gate opposite Shell station. Welcomed to stay the night. Because of our size we camped near road (noisy but have ear plugs) but were invited to camp further away from road near church accommodations (low trees to pass). While behind a wall the gate does not get closed so people come and go but felt secure enough. No water or toilet offered; we are self-sufficient so did not ask but there may be some available at the church buildings. Good for passing the night when you can’t make it to San Pedro before dark.

name: Chutes de Nawa
description: Stunning waterfall. Long but not high. You can definitely swim here. The last 2 km are a little bit rough.

name: Gonate Hospital
description: Small rural hospital with easy access and large open spaces. Granted permission to park and camp in truck. They offered to let us sleep in maternity waiting area (outdoor but undercover benches). Water taps available but sometimes locked. Pit toilets available. Friendly village with very curious children but they left after a while.

name: Empty Lot
description: Empty lot next to car lot. In the city center, security next door and also across the street.

name: Sûreté Plateau immigration HQ
description:
Place to extend CI visa. Cost CFA 38,100 to extend for three months. No option of cheaper or shorter. Need to be in person, one photo, copy of passport and complete application form they provide. Collect passport after two days. See photo for requirements. You get receipt for collection as well as for payment. They also take your biometrics. 


Enter through security and head past temp glass building and around to building on left with 3 or 4 steps. Office is third door on right on ground floor (porte 5).

name: Among the Trees
description: Many spots for wild camping for smaller vehicles like minivans with possibility to pitch a tent. Almost no local traffic except occasional villagers on bikes. There are dense bushes and trees around, which can hide you from the main road.

name: Auberge du Bonheur restaurant
description: Popular restaurant with shaded garden and menu with mostly African dishes (500-2000) and some Western food as well.

name: Auberge du Kong
description:
15.000 CFA for a room. 30.000 for a huge bungalow. Really nice and clean AC bungalows. Restaurant on site. Place for big vehicles. Not sure if camping is allowed. I think the rooms are good value for money compared to other places. plenty of places for cars and bikes to park behind gates. 
WiFi very slow, poor Orange / Moov network.

name: Local restaurant: good fish and rice
description: Small restaurant tucked away in a back alley popular with locals serving good fish and rice! Nice people.

name: L’Escale Tropicale (Pizza Tropicale)
description:
Super tasty thin crust pizza. Made well and not an oily mess! Walking distance from The Elephant’s Nest, Chloe recommended it to us. My partner and I split a large veggie pizza (4,500) and a salad (1,00), plus two Oranginas (delicious Italian pop, 600 each) and were quite satisfied. 
EDIT: We came back again and the staff were kind enough to make us a delicious vegetarian pasta with lots of veggies and tomato sauce. They only charged us 2,200 for two large portions of veggie pasta and two bottles of Orangina. 
The owner is a really lovely woman who grew up in France but moved to CI with her husband and children. Her name is Larissa had so much to say about grand bassam, she is a good person to contact/visit for info on what to do in the area.
You can reach her at: +225 4974 5460

name: Top Chef Chawarma (veg options!)
description: They have a whole bunch of things on their menu, from sandwiches and burgers, to kebabs and pizzas, to African classics, also salads and deserts. The veg options include pizzas, and French fry sandwhich and a few salads. They made us veggie Chawarma and a fatouche salad. the food wasn’t amazing, but so glad that we finally found something without fish/chicken/cow/pig/goat in it.

name: Restaurant Chawarma Les Delices
description: In our quest for vegetarian meals we came across some super delicious (but tiny) veggie chawarmas here. They made them for us special, and we ended up having 2 each. They were 1,500 CFA each. Would recommend.

name: Anunu- Eco Surf
description:
Campsite on the rise. Local surfer Tomar just started this place with help from his German friend Lena, before Corona came. Which made things quiet for a while. But now life is slowly coming back and there is a great camping area next to coconut trees. hidden and calm where you can pitch your hamog and chill without destruction. You even find drinking water from a natural source. If the tap happens to have no water, which it sometimes does, cause it crosses a whole community of fishermen before arriving at Anunu, there is always the chance to get water directly from the source, which is a 10 minutes walk. 
the place has an amazing beachside where you can hang out in the shade of the coconut trees, stroll along white beaches, blue water and red stones for hours without getting tired.  Or take a surf class or rent one of the surfboards from the best local surfer Ezekiel, which started surfing on wood planks until Lena brought him and the other kids some donated boards, in exchange for going to school, collecting rubbish and teaching each other in surf. Just ask Tomar and he will hook you up with Ezekiel. The village of Sassandra is only 20 minutes away by car to do your shopping basics. you get fresh and smoked fish, attieke and some basic foods 4 minutes walk from the camp ground in the little fishing community. 
Or you just ask Tomar to cook for you some amazing local dish. 
the idea of Tomar and Lena is that this place can create him an income and the local surfers have a place that they can call their club. When Lena and her husband Mohamed are there, they teach English and Yoga. They did build a schooling house for workshops and projects. The goal is to help the kids to help themselves, be kind, take care of their environment, and reach out to the (Surfing)world at one point on their own. 

Access with 4x4
3500cfa per night camping.

name: Tabou Beach
description:
Very nice place. You can sleep on the beach, go fishing with local people and visit the village. In the future that cape will be a campsite.
Call Fulgence Barou to organize: 47356785 or 56393052

name: near a small lake
description: narow road in to the woods, clean, quiet

name: Customs Cote d'Ivoire
description: CDP stamped in 5 min. Also the Passavant can be done here

name: Auberge catholique Petit Clerc
description: The place is very spacious, lot of trees and the rooms are also very large. Fan one for 5000cfa.

name: Overnight stop
description:
We took a small road off the goudron and drove up to trees nearby. Easy to find a place here. A bit loud because the street is close and some trafic, also in the night.
 Locals pass by in the morning, no problems. Lots of birds.

name: Village tanou sakassou
description: Pottery village. The craftsmen explain how it is done and show you their achievements. Small shop to buy a souvenir and encourage them

name: Unseen from the road
description: We wild camped here just behind the bushes, close to the road but unseen. It was very quiet and we saw lots of birds. The ground is not so flat and even with our levelers, we rolled a bit in bed, but it was ok. The ground has gravel instead of grass, which helped against the stingy ants and other insects.

name: Auberge la bonne etoile
description:
Great hotel with clean rooms and wifi. hot water shower, TV and Aircon. WiFi works fine in Room 4 where I stayed.

Double room XAF15k, breakfast XAF1k (omelette, bread, butter & coffee).

name: The beach. Bassam to assinie
description: Lite spot just behind the sea. Good place

name: Propane
description: Filling up gas bottles, have multiple adapters, also for German bottles

name: hotel hounki
description: practical hotel where you can park your car right next to your room and lock it in. small courtyard in the middle and walls around. not pretty but will do for the night. allowed camping in rtt as not many guests where there. were allowed to use the toilet and shower of one of the rooms, 10 000cfa (you might get a cheaper price if you ask more persistently). we only decided on the way out of town that it was enough driving for the day so we took this hotel, but there are several other hotels in gagnoa, also an evangelic mission and the centre Emmaus. might be worth asking as well as it looked like having a gorgeous courtyard.

name: Mechanic's House
description: This is a mechanic's home but has a few places to park for the night. Extremely friendly owner

name: Yacé Plage (Grâce Divine)
description: Seaside. At the border, there is the property guardian (djibrile). Very nice person (002250709345466) allowed people to camp. very quiet and remote. no village around for 5 km.

name: Black and White
description: European and African food. expats and locals

name: Hotel la Grace
description: Nice friendly hotel with good restaurant and clean pool

name: Mont niangbo
description: Very beautiful place. Alone. On the mountain.

name: Eco ferme de lokoli
description: Very nice place. On the river. You can make jetski and quad and other

name: Chez Yvann
description: A nice place where you can eat from breakfast to dinner. They have a menu with some choices also soups spaghetti e cous cous. The have cold beer. The price is reasonable. We also had our breakfast the day after omelette and caffè au lait baguette butter at 1000 fca each.

name: Shazil pizzeria and restaurant
description: The only place we found close to our accommodation. There's a dehor with some tables and a climatized room. Outside is more informal. Staff very nice. You can eat pizza salads burgers and pasta. There's beer. One large pizza Margherita is 6500 fca and a big salad 4500 fca. Everything was good😀

name: no named
description: One of the plenty street restaurants, with young and friendly staff. Good and fresh food. You can eat grilled fish or chicken just cooked with vegetable and chips. Beer and water are available. Good job!

name: Mamadou traoré mecanic
description:
I visit this guy for changing sime spare parts on our defender, the garage is cery clean and well orginised. Mamadou have some good mecanic skill and know what to do. 
If you need some work this place is good for overlanders. 
The phone number is: +225 0707617015

name: Garage Lagunaire
description:
Traoré regularly gets Toyota training in Europe.  He runs a great team of mechanics, he's honest, does thorough work at a fair price!
Excellent with big rigs and 4x4.  Will try to source all parts needed, however difficult.
His garage also has panel beaters and can do a respray.

name: Residence Bethany Palace
description:
16700 via booking.com (don‘t book ahead, read comments ) for double room with private shower, AC and Wifi. 
Without Booking cheapest is 18.000. Many other room categories available, please read comments. 
Safe parking and friendly, English speaking staff!
Very good location.

name: Hotel Aliekro
description: Nice hotel, restaurant, bar, parking inside. Safe and nice place.

name: nice spot next to the village
description: Trying to find a spot for the night, we asked locals if we could spend night around here. (the little village does not appear on map) very friendly, the chief allowed us to stay next to the little dam. Children came for a while but were very nice and not to "intrusive". Peaceful place. Always ask before to stay.

name: old truck weighing station
description: old truck weighing station next to the road A4. Quiet Place zo stay overnight. Perfect for big Rigs and small ones. just park on the scale it‘s perfectly flat

name: Residence Aman
description: Situated outside of the city, it offers good value for money. only 15000 CFA a double with hot shower, WC, AC. clean and nice. a little bit hard to find, it is a 1km unpaved road through the bush from A6. Google maps has the exact location. it can't be seen from the main road, it is well hidden in the bush. Even in front of it you can't be sure this is it. But well worth coming.

name: Hôtel du 3éme Pont
description:
Central and possibly one of the cheapest options around. Heavy traffic galore.
15k / room, there is WiFi (weak signal) and running cold water.

name: Ministère de l'intérieur
description:
Do not believe Google Maps, this is the place to get authorisation du sortie. 
Done on the spot, free of charge, should be submitted 3 days before crossing the border.  The clerks inside explain everything, even can give you a template for the request  Across the main road there is a place to print the letter and they even have the template themselves and know what to do. copy of passport required.  If you state a date you can show up at the border later than that date, I asked

name: Hotel Le Printemps
description:
12k / 15k / 18k rooms with AC.
Slow WiFi + hot water.
Safe parking 
Clean & comfortable
many maquis around
Cheapest rooms may be taken if you arrive late.
The hotel across the street has rooms for 15k but when I tried it, they had no water and only offered buckets for the same price.

name: Chez Yed
description:
Wonderful maquis, amazing atmosphere, excellent tasty food at regular prices.  Owner & his wife speak English, his wife spent several years in Houston

Not to be missed, a short walk from Hotel Maya & opposite Boulangerie Opera

name: Hotel bongne
description: hotel in the road before go inside the town, confortable and staff very friendly. price between 8.000-10.000. Drink tea with security people siting in a carpet in the carpet before go to sleep, not have price.  and was that not price because they invite me.

name: hotel La Falaise
description: hotel with private parking, also accesible for higher vehicles (but not unlimited). 15k for a night, big clean rooms with running water, clean towels and airconditioning.

name: Yamaha Motorcyles by cfao
description: Yamaha Moto dealership offering new (small displacement) motorbikes and service for all Yamaha motos.  Best to bring your own parts, or else you may have to wait a day or two for them to get the parts for you. Service was professional and reasonably priced.

name: Small shop
description: shop selling water, phone credit, basic food

name: cycle mechanic
description: cycle mechanic with many basic parts. helpful if you have some of your own too.

name: Sô Black Restaurant
description: Really delicious food with great laid back atmosphere. Fried chicken and chips for 3.000 cfa and the most delicious fish soup and rice for 7.000 cfa.

name: Hotel Espoir
description: AC rooms 12.5k, tiny fan rooms 8k. Clean and comfortable. Great parking for motorcycles and vehicles.

name: General Mechanic
description:
Our clutch broke in Daloa and Tano the mechanic found us and offered us assistance! He arranged a tow to the garage, went to Abidjan to search for the clutch for our Defender and fixed it in a few hours. The garage is not clearly marked but all were friendly and the vehicle was safe there for 3 days. We paid 120.000 cfa for the labour. 
Tano’s phone number is +225 07 58 261 839. They only speak French. 
There is a spare parts shop across the road which is well stocked - just not with Land Rover parts!!

name: Maquis restaurant Chez Kambiré
description: Allowed me to camp 2 nights under shelter for cost of 2 dinners. Dinner was 4000f, large beer 600f.

name: bar with shelter
description: friendly bar, beer 500f , allowed me to set up my tent under a shelter. excellent restaurant across the road selling meals for 1,500

name: Sinaly Garba
description: Restaurant owned by friendly Mr. Sinaly. They serve Garba (grated casava with tuna fish and condiments) for 800-1000 FCFA depending on the quantity you order. Quality food, friendly staff, outdoor restaurant that has a nice vibe, you feel welcomed right in. Absolutely recommend it.

name: friendly bar you can camp at
description: friendly bar, helped me find the tools I need to fix my bike in town. allowed me to camp after buying a few beers

name: banque populaire
description: bank with an ATM. no problems withdrawing cfa.

name: Bar
description: Bar which allowed me to camp after I bought some drinks. They overcharged for the drinks, but I'm counting that as a camping fee.

name: Corridor Maquis Resto
description: Restaurant which let me sleep after I bought a main (2000cfa)

name: Chez Francois
description: Great lovely restaurant and hotel. Spacious rooms with hot shower and AC for 25K. Great restaurant with nice food and cold beer. Can be crowdy at weekends, but during the week it is super calm and relaxing. You can even play some tennis here. I have stored by motorbike in the gym. It is around 12km from embassies.

name: Bon Prix Supermarket
description: Supermarket with european products.  Its cheap but no meat or vegetables / fruits. There is plenty of alcohol choices, reasonable prices. Feels like paradise after Guinea !

name: Hotel Émergence
description:
They opened the back courtyard for us to camp with our truck camper. There is room for 2 véhicles maybe 3 if you squeeze. You can use the bathroom in the reception. There is a restaurant that we havent tried but they dont sell beers. For that, there is a bar one minute up the street (50cl beer for 500CFA). Nothing special about the place, its a one night stop kind of thing. They asked for 5000 CFA after negociation... Pricy but not many other options in the area. Maybe you can ask for a discount if you also eat at the restaurant ... For food, we tried the chinese restaurant 3 min away.
Not amazing, quite expansive but it was good to get away from african cuisine for a meal.

name: Market, vegetables and fruits
description: Big market place where you can find everything you want (almost). Tomatoes, cucumbers, green peppers, onions, eggs, avocados, papayas...etc. As usual in CFA countries, try to bring small money, as locals don't like big notes and wont have change. The market is a covered square, not easy to spot because surrounded by little houses / shops. Ask locals if you don't find "le marché", they are really nice.

name: Douane if you don’t have CPD
description:
There is a new douane office in Danané for the « vignette touristique ». That’s the document you need if you don’t have CPD or ATA (same as a passavant). Be prepared, it can be hard to have it (it was super hard for us).

The law says you have the right for two months FREE to travel with a foreign vehicle. 

At the douane they showed us a document saying the contrary. But it was from 2010.
We called our embassy, and Chloe from Grand Bassam who helped us a lot (embassy was useless). She gave us the link to the right law text from 2017.

We showed it to the police that didn’t know about it. They never asked about money so we don’t know if they really didn’t know about the right text or if at the end they would have asked for something. They were actually pretty nice but not aware of the law.

24h blocked in Danané just for this paper which we finally had for free at the end. What a waste of time..

Here is the link to the right law if needed : 

https://www.douanes.ci/sites/default/files/base_documentaire/3592.pdf

Hope they will be more aware now ! Stay patient, calm and show the law :) 60 days free for foreign vehicule !

name: Market (vegetables)
description: The nicest market we have seen so far in West Africa. The floor is paved, its covered, its big, there is room to walk, people are (as usual) very friendly, and there is every vegetables you need ! Not many fruits options when we were there but we found pineapples.  Good place to stock up if you plan to stay along the beautiful seaside !

name: Small Supermarket
description:
Small Supermarket with european products. Not crazy but that can save a day. Lot of alcohol choice compare to the rest ! Plenty of place to park on front. 
There is also a bank nearby (300m) with a functional ATM and a gas station. Quite a nice city center here.

name: Corrupted checkpoint
description:
We were stopped at the barrier by police. They immediately demanded us to pay them and took the international driving license. We refused to pay so they put us aside and made us wait. After some time, another officer came and asked for more documents (insurance, cdp...). After some more waiting, they gave us the documents back and let us go. 

Don't pay anything.

name: Hidden gravel place near the road
description:
Big flat gravel place right next to the main road. You can hear the traffic (not heavy at night) but people can’t see you from the road.
Looks like a place where they took (or stored) the gravel to build the road.

name: Banque Atlantique ATM no fee
description: It accepts MasterCard with no fee (I don't know if it accepts visa, I guess so)

name: Photocopy shop
description: This is where you can tape and print you "Exit authorization" to leave CI. They ask 1000 CFA for the job. We didnt try to negociate. Quite fast, they are used to it.
