The shop is situated at the far back of the market. It is a little building. Its not the first copy shop that you see in the middle of the market.

name: Maquis Vietnamien
description: Amazing vietnamese food at really affordable price. The place is far from being fancy (its a maquis after all) but its good ! Best food we had since... Barcelona. The noodle bowl (bo bun) is very good, 3000CFA. We also tried the chicken and ginger, also good, 3500CFA. Beer is 1000 CFA (60cL). A really good surprise in Abidjan.

name: Villa Cacao and Villa Mango
description: Great place to stay if you need a nice break! Jean Marc owns both villas. We called him and booked mid-week for 60k a night. Not cheap, but close to the embassies and very peaceful. Air conditioning works pretty well, could be a bit cooler but the rooms are big, ours has a bath tub. We were able to park our 3.2m high rig inside Villa Cacao, very secure. You can find Villa Mango on booking.com, his number is also listed on Google and he speaks French. Some of the staff speak a bit of English. Good places to eat nearby, and the included hotel breakfast is excellent.  our last night some other overlander friends were passing through so we asked if they could sleep on the residential street. He insisted they park inside the walls, use the pool and shower. Was very welcoming and interested in travelers.

name: Mouyassue Hotel
description: Nice hotel on the way to the Ghana border. Very clean rooms with, mosquito nets (on the Windows), fan and running water for 10000 FCFA. There are also rooms with AC and warm water for 17000. Friendly owner.

name: Paradise beach
description:
beautiful spot to camp on a deserted beach. there is few abandoned bungalows and a gardian who keep the place clean. there is toilets and they give you fresh clean water for a bucket shower. people here are very nice, in the evening they make you a fire if you want to cook. they can also sell you fresh fish or langouste (7000cfa /kg for langouste, we didn't ask the price for fish). they offered us fresh coconuts. there is no official price to sleep here, you can give what you want, we gave 3000cfa.
the view is absolutely amazing and it is very quiet. 4x4 absolutely required. no cellphone/4g network.

name: WILD PARADISE
description:
Welcome in Victory Les Flots, close to Kounoukou Village !

This place was our best bivouac in Ivory Coast. Located on an abandoned lodge, between ocean, forest, lagoon, forest and coconut trees.

The place to camp is free BUT there are 2 amazing guys (Éric and Meda) who are taking good care of the place and of you !
In exchange of some money (at the end of our stay), they carried water (shower and toilets) for us, coconut, grilled fishes on the fire, dishes ... 
Well, we are absolutely not used to this "services" thing BUT its a way for them to earn some money AND a way for the travellers to have an amazing and quiet place for camping.
SO, a pretty good deal :)

Before coming here, please call Eric : +225 05 06 88 5147 / +225 01 43 92 4628

ENJOY THE PLACE !

PS : Note that the track to come here is quite narrow (not sure for big trucks) and could be really difficult (mud) during rainy season.

name: Papi Garage
description:
Nice garage run by Yoann and his father. Established here since more than 40 years. We didn't do mechanics there (because we do everything by ourselves) BUT Yoann allowed us to use some of their tools for our own parts repair ! He was really helpful for many things (he helped us to sell our old - but still in good shape - tires) and gave us different good contacts.

They can take care of all type of vehicles, and they have space ;)

name: Hotel du Centre
description: Good Place, nice rooms with AC and fast wifi. Price 7000/10000/12000 per night, It depends on rooms.

name: in the bush, near a path.
description: Small clearing to the right of a bush path which leads to fields.  A few curious workers come to greet you.  Friendly gendarmes came to greet us in the morning.  They advised us to report before to the nearest gendarmerie (in the village before Logoualé).  Quiet night.

name: Misōa
description:
Wonderful hotel run by Gary and Audrey.  Gary is a rally driver, several times Ivory Coast champion.  Due to his sporting activity, he has traveled many trails across his country, he has valuable advice.  
The hotel is a refreshing break in Abidjan with its swimming pool and air-conditioned rooms.  
The restaurant is of good quality.  After 6 months of travel, it did us good to allow ourselves this little luxury.  
Place known thanks to Ahmed from 4x4 off-road CI.  
Very welcoming place for overlanders.

name: Le méchoui
description: Lebanese restaurant. Expensive. Class. Kinda feels wrong being there but the food is absolutely amazing. If you feel like you deserve a treat you won’t be disappointed!

name: La pagode (Asian)
description: Good Asian restaurant, Abidjan prices (same price as Burger King….). Handy if your stuck at the garage nearby!

name: Hyper U Supermarket / Mall
description:
Huge French supermarket. Prices are huge too as it’s all imported from France. 

Supermarket is located in a shopping mall.

name: Casa Mexicana
description:
Great spot if you’d like to have a drink (with or without alcohol). Happy hour 17-20h everyday. Food looks very good but although we’ve been there 4 times (yes…) we haven’t tried personally.
Hadi (the boss) is absolutely fantastic!

name: SAAR ASSURANCES
description:
Perfect place to get a new car insurance (carte brune & carte blanche - CEDEAO)

45.000 CFA for 6 Months
The best price we found in Abidjan !

Really professional and friendly team :)

name: OKEY PARTS
description:
They have lots of parts, particularly for Land Rover Defender, in that place.

Prices are ok.

Friendly staff :)

-

In this street and all around, lots off parts shops for almost all brands !

name: Potiers de Tanoh Sakassou
description:
Here, the village is doing ivorian poteries since several years. Yanis and his team are doing an amazing job and they are really happy to talk about it :)

Everybody is really friendly

If you want to support them, you can buy some poteries in their boutique ;)

name: local food
description: Mickey's restaurant. very good and cheap local restaurant on the beach. around 2000cfa a plate. calm and quiet

name: Noura Hotel
description: Nice and clean hotel with private bathroom and air conditioner, the single/doble room is 15.000CFA, they also have parking. 8 minutes walking to the beach.

name: Sococe
description: Supermarket, close to European standards! Do your shopping before exploring the hidden beaches around !

name: Crocodiles
description: You can see crocodiles here from a safe viewing spot.

name: Flat ground out of sight
description: Entrance on a dirt road that leads to the new bridge. A great spot out of sight from both the old road and the new bridge. Nobody came during the night and we got woken up by birds.

name: Respect Family
description:
Very nice campground on private property, next to a well, shaded huts and very well maintenance clean beach. 

Take the boat for 300cfca from Cool Mafia and walk to ‘Respect Family’. Upon arrival ask for the owner, the locals call him Respect.

Camping: 8,000 for two people per night 
Mattress with mosquito net on beach: 20,000

name: Hôtel Jean Mermoz
description:
Cheap option for Bouaké, not far from the city centre. 
Self-contained rooms with fan run from 5k for the little dark rooms inside to 7k for the spacier ones around the courtyard (with TV as a bonus). A/C rooms are around 10k.
Basic, but clean enough. 

Big parking space. Didn't ask about camping, but I assume it's possible (refer to other entry, different location, same name).

name: Hwy A8
description: Very close to a beautiful river for a short swim. Its a parking bay right next to the street. I mean you could also sleep there but its not easy to find an even place.

name: Hotel les Tropics
description: Not expensive but good conditions. AC in the room. very helpful staff. I went to eat something after 40 min they call me asking if everything is ok

name: Hotel Aladjé
description:
The hotel is far of the downtown and the neighborhood is not beautiful. But the room (with bathroom, good AC, TV and bad Wi-Fi) is cheap, comparing to Abidjan’ prices: 15k XOF. 

There’s a good restaurant inside, with breakfast (3k), plates (4,5k to 14,5k) and a lot of drinks.

name: Coffee Shop Factory
description: Nice coffee shop, with a big variety of coffees (espresso is 1,5k xof), juices, sandwiches (>6k xof) and salades. It’s a little expensive, but all the neighborhood is

name: Next to university
description: Very quiet spot next to the university of Man. Students don’t mind at all. Nice view over the mountains. No insects at night.

name: Simple spot between cashew trees
description: A perfect spot to spend a quiet afternoon and night. You are hidden from the road and path. Nobody bothered us… no sounds of the road and no insects. No view either but a nice place to relax…

name: Many options
description: We found a spot here in the bush, but you can also drive to a river and there are many more options. Some scooters pass but that is all. Quiet and peaceful.

name: TISSERAND
description: Take the time to stop in this coop to admire the work of the weavers and their incredible works.

name: Wild camping on a great rock/ flat area down farm path
description: Follow this path slightly past these coordinates (we’ve just left the spot). It’s a peaceful clearing next to a farm on a big rock underground. Just past one house and before another two houses. Everyone was very happy for us to stay - we went and sat with them in the morning for a few minutes to say thank you

name: Between rubber and palm trees
description: So beautiful here with all these trees palm and rubber… and also a lot of shade! A nice and Quiet spot. Sometimes a scooter came by but they did not mind us.

name: Centre Anuarite
description: Catholic mission a bit further from the main road. Clean and calm.They have dormitories (mine was 6-bed but I was alone) for 2000CFA, and a walled garden to park every type if vehicle or pitch a tent. Bucket shower and toilets outside. Nice and cheap option before crossing into Ghana.

name: Residence la Grâce
description: Very nice hotel, in quiet area. The rooms are spacious, very clean and equipped with a tiny kitchen and a small balcony. They have AC, hot water. If you want to, they clean every day. Big and comfortable bed. Very friendly staff, safe parking. Restaurant is not bad but not really worth the money. It's 2.3 km from the Ghana embassy. We payed 25.000 for double room.

name: Serpentarium de l’institut pasteur
description: we visited this Serpentarium and it was very interesting.  the person who visits is passionate and answers all your questions.  to visit to learn more about snakes.  you can even touch it

name: Money services: Western Union / Moneygram
description: Good office to get your Western Union or Moneygram money, and much more. See picture for more info and opening hours.

name: TOP MOTO
description:
Motorbike shop and garage, accessories, tyres, parts, mechanics, maintenance... specialised in European brands (Yamaha, KTM..., Bihr, LS2, Japan, Taiwan...)
Owner is an enduro enthusiast, very good knowledge of European motorbike mechanics, possibility of free use of the workshop for travellers...
A very good motorbike address in Abidjan.

name: Next to a power pole on a hill
description: We couldn’t reach San Pedro before nightfall so we looked for place to spend the night. It’s quite hard to find anything in this area since it’s densely populated. We took an unused and very steep piste up a small hill and camped next to a power pole. You can hear the road but we managed to park in a way that no one could see us. Internet connection is good here. No one came by all evening and morning and it ended up being quite a decent spot. I actually don’t think that people come by here often. Only accessible for small 4x4 vehicles.

name: Africa Batik
description: Beautiful batik, and Idriz can explain and show you how he does it. Very nice cloches.

name: Restaurant à la napolitaine
description: Restaurant serving pizzas, pasta and chawarma.. we took a pizza for 8k FCFA and 3 drinks for 3k FCFA. Very clean and tasty.

name: palmyre
description:
I fount this jewell by pure chance
It's a motel-type hotel. 6K per night, privat room with privat restroom with shower!! The room is very clean, they even gave me towel and toilet paper! Fan included! 
The place is at the end of a campound.
The best place to stay in Korhogo
I think the name was Palmyre Hotel. In front of a bank, in a street where people sell vegetables.

name: Yatou Motors
description:
Motorcycle repair shop, diagnostic, programming, coding.
Specialist in adventure bikes. 
Motorcycle accessories, helmets, clothing, spare parts, motorcycle oils. 
The perfect stop for all adventurers and motorcycle travelers.

name: Chez Mario
description: Nice Italian restaurant with good pizza’s! Outdoor and indoor seating area. Pizza from 7.000 CFA. You can park in front of the restaurant.

name: Shawarma Le Prince
description:
Shawarma 2000, burger 2500, fataya, salads, pizza, etc.
Best shawarma we had so far in all of west Africa,and we eat a lot of shawarma
friendly waitress and kitchen is clean

name: Hotel de L'Ouest
description: Simple and cheap hotel, well placed near the city center. There are rooms for 5000, 7000 and 10000 cfa. It was rather clean and quiet. There is a parking for big rigs if necessary.

name: Print shop
description: Cauli Baly is running a print shop. Very friendly guy. He speaks English.

name: Hotel Eden
description: Cheap and simple hotel in the newly paved coastal road. Has a fan, sells beer, and is near the city market. Ok for one night.

name: Land Rover Koumassi
description:
Land Rover Specialist only.
Antoine and his team are formidable workers and people!
Defenders, discovery and they have parts.
Perfect as always They will made their possible to fix your car

name: Mazko de Bringo
description:
Camping with many choices. The proprietor is knowledgeable.
.....
Camping avec plusieur tantes. + dinfos contact= 05.06.73.80.27

name: Chez Flavio
description:
Superb place!
The setting is magnificent. Shade, toilets, showers, barbecue area, large table and direct access to the beach and the natural pools (only accessible at low tide)
You are here with Flavio, who lives in San Pedro.
Désiré, on site, takes care of everything you need. He can set up tents, cook food, etc.
No internet connection.
To get there, direction tabaoulé, then to the ecolodge, continue the path, it is the next gate, on the left.
10000cfa per person and per 24 hours.
Flavio: +2250707696750
--
Superbe endroit !
Le cadre est magnifique. De l ombre, des toilettes, des douches, un espace barbecue, une grande table et un acces direct à la plage et aux piscines naturelles (uniquement accessibles à marée basse)
Vous etes ici chez Flavio, qui vit à San Pedro. 
Désiré, sur place, s occupe de tout ce dont vous avez besoin. Il peut monter des tentes, faire a manger, etc. 
Aucune connexion internet. 
Pour y acceder, direction tabaoulé, puis à l ecolodge, continuez le chemin, c est le portail suivant, à gauche. 
10000cfa par personne et par 24h. 
Flavio : +2250707696750

name: Village de BATEDRE I
description:
Beautiful beach, under the coconut trees.
The village chief, Charles, whose house is next to the small football field when we arrived, allowed us to sleep here.
He wanted 10,000 CFA for the night.
We negotiated at 3000 because there is no convenience.
We are really at the seaside. Locals can come by during the day, very nice.
We can have water (not drinkable) if necessary.
Nice place, very nice
--
Belle plage, sous les cocotiers. 
Le chef du village, Charles, dont la maison est à côté du petit terrain de football en arrivant, nous a autorisé à dormir ici. 
Il voulait 10000 cfa pour la nuit. 
Nous avons negocié à 3000 car il n y aucune commodité. 
On est vraiment au bord de mer.  Des locaux peuvent passer dans la journee, tres gentils. 
On peut avoir de l eau (non potable) si besoin. 
Bel endroit, tres agreable

name: Monkeys Ancestors
description:
For the people of this village, the monkeys are part of the village, they are their ancestors. If you stop here they will tell you the story and you can see the monkeys.
When we were here, we met the responsible person for Eau et Forêt and he confirmed that this small forest and the monkeys are protected by them.
You have to pay a contribution but highly recommended to negotiate, the first price is just crazy.
People in the village are friendly.
I don't know if they speak english.

name: Bennin Embbassy
description:
here is the consulate of bennin. the other location is wrong (a few month ago).
comming to get info about the visa, my uruguayan passport could be very psrticularr.
they told me that the evisa is only to arrive by plane, to go by land "dont need a visa".
i understand that get the visa on the border.

name: Superbe plage
description:
Beautiful beach after the fisherman village. 
Is possible to camp but we didn’t. We asked for the price they said it has to be discussed at the moment. But very friendly people so I guess it’s possible to have honest price. 
Little bay very since for swim, and clean. 
Also possible to stay in some beautiful house on the beach. 
Possible to eat fish or languste. 
You can call in advance +225 101261782
Or +225 152844808

name: Detente Hotel
description:
A lovely little hotel within easy reach of the freeway if coming from the west.

Rooms are really well finished with a superb bathroom with shower.

There is a central courtyard with a fountain, chairs and bar.

Parking out front with 24hour staff. 

Via booking.com we paid 32,000 CFA for a night.

name: ONYX Hotel Yamoussoukro
description:
A relatively new hotel just off the road (by a confusing junction).

Very friendly staff, lovely clean double rooms with shower, toilet, air con, etc.

They have a pool, restaurant, and very soon a roof top bar.

We got a room for 31,000CFA on booking.com

Secure parking out front

name: Monogaga
description: The village has 2 or 3 bungalows for visitors and a place on the beach for overlander (not possible to sleep here without paying. The piste arrive in the village which is also the begining of the beach...). They told us we give what we want. Nice place, friendly People.

name: Campement chez Dominique
description: Take the piste until the beach. Don't go on the right side (Black wood door), take the left and you arrive at this simple place. You can stay here for the day for 1000 cfa/p or sleeping here for 2000cfa/p. Basics toilets and shower with the water of the sea... better to bring your own clean water ! There is a tent décathlon that you can rent. The place is on the beautiful beach, really quiet. We enjoyed it.

name: Vatouo
description:
Visit the longest bridge and still in us for the locals . Entrance with tickets 
You can camp or stay in your vehicle just in front.
You just have to meet the chef of the village or the official guide of the village Jasinthu who is helpful and friendly.

name: Maison aristocrate
description: We stayed here 10 days, waiting for our Ghana visa, cleaning our car and staff and visiting Abidjan. Private room with private bathroom (hot water) in a nice villa. Really Really clean. Fast and perfect WiFi. We can use the kitchen. A lot of facilites around. The car is parked in front of the house in the street, safe because inside a guarded cité (but maybe not adapted for truck, better asking to the owner Sébastien first). You can book on airbnb or they have website (aristocratedabidjan.com). We paid 15000 cfa per night for 2 personns. Marie and Julie who take care of the house are really friendly and helpfull. Really enjoyed our stay here !

name: hotel la source
description:
Hotel rooms from 10000cfa to 20000cfa 
Clean, AC, hot water.
Espace for parking

name: Hôtel la Colombe
description: Very friendly owner. Rooms are big and really clean. Starting from 7.000 (fan, with private shower and bathropm), 10.000 (AC with private shower and bathroom) to 20.000 for bigger and fancier rooms.

name: Auberge du compte
description: Cheap option in thr city. Rooms for 15.000, 7.000 or 5.000 CFA with AC or Fan. Mine was ok, but the bed was very uncomfortable.

name: Hotel
description:
basic Hotel close to the coastal road. small rooms + bathrooms with toilet and bucket shower. 
room with fan 5000 CFA,
room with A/C 10000 CFA.

rooms with fan a good/ ok value but rooms with A/C seems overpriced. Restaurant on side is not working. Very basic Restaurant and shop can be found in the village - ask around. Overall a good place for one night.

name: In a village in a HEVEA field
description:
We took the A7 piste from north to south, and stopped in this village for the night after asking the chief of the village, he said we are welcome to stay for the night on the football field and have some water if needed 
When we arrived all the kids were playing football so we went a bit further in the hevea tree field, the owner said its ok for us to stay
Lots of locals came to say hi and pass by, all really nice

name: Issia
description:
Big parking lot for trucks.Security garde.Quiet  Just at the end of the town
Toilet, shower with bucket 
Just give what you want.
 We slept in our Land Rover

name: Secured place for one night during A7 travel
description:
If you are looking to spend the night in a nice, secured and open space aera, before continue the A7 tomorrow, this is the place you are looking for. 

Entering Nigre from north, just ask the village's chief, one of the first house to the right.

He will be happy to welcome you and offer you water. He will then bring you to the football field of the village.

Quiet enough at night, villagers are respectful, just looking from far at some moments. No asking for money or anything.

We got a great feeling with the people here and spent a good night !

name: Hotel Refuge
description:
Small hotel with clean rooms and not too expensive. Shower with good pressure! 
5.000 cfa for room with fan.
7.000 cfa for room with fan and TV.
10.000 cfa for room with AC.
12.000 cfa for room with AC and TV.
Secure parking.

name: Supermaket, Restaurant and Bakery
description: Supermarket with european goods, as well a restaurant and a bakery in one building

name: Abidjan Quartier Marcory
description:
Friendly and helpful team. Garage with some parts for Land Rover.
You can stay in your car during the work.
Oner Mr Diakite phone number+225 07 83 77 93 or +225 01 57 71 19

name: Abidjan  Quartier Vallon
description:
Near residence. Valerie is a very good, friendly and helpful mechanic.
He can find all parts. Works well and quickly. 
Mr Diebre Oud Tel 07 59 27 78 01

name: Camaye Cooperative
description:
This is a cocoa cooperative which is unassuming from the exterior but they sell cocoa powder, pure 100% chocolate in tablet form, natural soaps, cocoa butter etc

The President of this company is commited to stopping child labour, child traffick and exploitation in the industry.  He has women making the cocoa products and soaps.  He is the Ivorian President of NGO CREER, a transit centre for trafficked, exploited and abused children set up by Chloe of West Africa Travellers in 2010.  Worth a stop to support children and women.

name: Monogaga Beach
description:
This is part of Monogaga Beach restaurant in the small rubber seedling plantation,  beside the dam that feeds water into Abengourou. Mr Tanoh runs it and is very keen to have overlanders join him, he used to run Assiny Palms. Travelers have the ability to fish and visit cocoa coffee and vegetables farms.

The road down through the area of Adoah is tarmac then after the left turn 150m from the main road it all becomes rough, doable in 2WD taxis though!  There's an roofless concrete toilet (long drop) block 

Phone signal is ok but not so strong.  There's security for the dam who'll also keep an eye out for overlanders.

name: mud mosque Kouto
description: small mud mosque, one of only a few left in norther cote d'ivoire. If you are in area its worth a visit.

name: Hand-Made Wood sculptures (masks, etc...)
description:
In Koko, you will find the place where wood scultures are made, like traditional masks and many others. 

Very interesting story and fair price. 

You can contact Sorho Zana (what's app +225506715877 or 0506715877), he will explain to you the culture of masks in his shop (free). 

Price are around 10.000 for small up to 25.000 for big masks. You can negotiate the price a little bit.

name: Village des Tisserands (Weaver)
description:
Village des Tisserands
Original weavers from Ivory Coast
All hands made, more than 300 weavers working as a cooperative
Very interesting culture 
Fixed price, lot of choice

name: Local pottery and pearls/beads
description: Local workers, artists that work in cooperative and sell their work

name: Hotel Batilwi
description: Hotel in small village, room are ok, shower in the room, electricity ok, room for 3000 cfa

name: Nice big spot for the night in the north
description:
Nice and quiet place not far from the main road on a dirt track, lots of field of cashews around 
Some locals with motorbike passing by and cows 
4x4 needed to cross the hole between the track and the Place

name: Traversée
description: Crossing the river, they will ask you for 20k better to go to the villa and ask for Nicolas chef of the village, normal price 500 cfa/per 3000 cfa for moto

name: Greenland - 4x4 Off-road.ci
description:
Greenland is a campsite directly next to the beach underneath Cocopalms. Beautifully quite spot with security and a toilet hut.

The campsite is from the owner (Ahmed) of the garage 4x4offroad.ci in Abidjan. At the moment it is still under construction therefor Ahmed doesn’t ask for a payment, if you want you can leave a donation. 

You can either visit the garage or give him a call to stay at the place. +2250779555551

name: Hotel before oume
description: Hotel 8 km before oume, nothing special, clean, electricity, 5000 Cfa for a room,

name: Patisserie
description: small patisserie and ice cream shop! 500 F for one scoop

name: Water tab with drinking water
description: We filled up our water tanks directly at the border. The water is from a fresh source and drinkable. Tab is right next to the immigration office where you stamp the passport on Ivory Coast side

name: Proshop bike
description: Bike shop you can fond tires, wheels, and they can fix bike in anidjan

name: Evelve ci
description: Bike shop very professional they can order part from Europe for 10 days !

name: Silver King Hotel
description:
Clean basic double rooms for 13000 XOF. Hot water, Airco, good bed with clean sheets. Rooms have TV. There is a restaurant.
Secure place.

name: Hotel Bemosso
description: Small hotel in the city centre next to Bom prix supermarket and open air market. 11000 CFA for a double with airco, private bathroom. Small but clean room, No WiFi

name: Bandre borders
description: Small borders ! They don’t have the exit stamp he said that they’re not here today ! Road was challenging with the rain will be sandy in dry season but worth the effort

name: Ghana immigration
description:
Small post for Ghana immigration, they have the stamp, friendly 
No stamp in IC

name: Between trees
description: Take a path from the road towards Oidienné to the right.  There is a sign for a cassava farming project.  After the cultivation area, the path is in disuse.  We turn to the right, the path widens and there is space between trees.  We have spent a perfect night.  We haven't seen anyone.  You can hear the road but there is very little traffic

name: Under the cashew tres (cajú)
description: Near the track and a path that leads to the crops.  Some peasants and children with cows going by at dusk, very friendly.  During the night Peace and quiet.

name: Into the bush
description: nice spot into the bush.  Clean and many space. It's necessary a 4x4. Near the road but absolutly hidden.

name: Nem Vietnamese Restaurant
description: Amazing, yummy, healthy food. Super nice owners. Opens at 11 am

name: Chilled place, Next to the autoroute
description:
Perfect for a sleep over before continuing the road to the north.
You here the cars but no too bad and its a spacious area where you are alone

name: Sous palmier
description:
A chill restaurant between palm trees 
Good food 
We got Foto with fish, was good

name: Perfect chilled spot towards boarders
description: Nice, quiete, next to the road. An old rocks work

name: Ferry
description:
Small boat connecting to Zl De Vridi.
Not for cars, motorbike. Only foot passengers and bicycle.
The fare 250CFA. But if you have bicycle it may better to give small tipping for the local porters. Because all luggage are loaded on the top of the boat.

name: Hotel La Resma
description:
Once you are through the steel gates, it's a little oasis. Much nicer than it looks from the road. 
Rooms start from 15,000 CFA (£20). 
Even the smallest room is fine for two people. AC. Hot water. Towels. Clean. 
Managed entirely by ladies: Seka and other family members. They are all sweet, funny and helpful. 
They sorted me out with a SIM, phone credit, motorbike washing, taxis and some breakfast. 
And they listened politely to my "travellers' tales".  
Lovely people. Highly recommended. 
Phone: 0778333345; 0102039393

name: Congo Embassy
description: Details to follow. Congo Embassy with helpful visa staff

name: Grand Bassam
description: Motorbike mechanic. Fixed my power loss and intermittent cutting-out. Gave the bike a thorough check over. It's running perfectly now. Good guy.  Name: Abdoulaye. +2250153420395

name: Modaci Service Shop and Parts
description:
Full Service parts and repair shop. Owner English speaking - all types of service and parts. Very friendly and helpful owner. I found octane boost, injector cleaner and chain lube here.
Cell - 07 07 07 75 75 / Darwiche

name: Hotel Zenith
description: Very nice hotel next to the lagoon. This is the right location. Rooms with AC, cold beer. a very peaceful place.

name: Hotel Popaix
description: Very nice hotel near the lagoon, room with AC and private bathroom . 20.000 XOF. Cold beer and private parking

name: X cafeteria
description: Here they sell good and cheap coffee. I bought an expresso for $0.6 and a Cappuccino for 500cfa. Very friendly and nice people at local cafe here. Just opposite a school and across the room I am staying at

name: Very nice airbnb, safe car parking
description: Nice airbnb with big rooftop, tabletennis, kicker, big TV, fast Wi-Fi. You can park your car in front of the house behind a big door.

name: BBQ Restaurant Anaxou
description: Nice Place with great food. Thuerry the owner will do anything to help you.

name: better than nothing 2.0
description:
we were looking for a spot for the night on our way to the coast. it's hard to find a good place along the way. 
we arrived at around 8pm when it already was dark. it's hidden from the main street but you can hear the cars and there is a path which locals probably use. nobody passed when we were there.

entry from the main road is  here: 
5.489106, -6.559907

name: Beside a gravelled road
description: The place is easy reachable also for bigger rigs. It appears to be an entrance to a mine. There is also a security few meters further. Some traffic in the evening and early morning. But no one bothered us.

name: Place for a night
description: The place is nothing special but good for a night. Few people passing by but no one bothered us. Easy to reach and also good for bigger rigs.

name: The Lotusplace
description:
Close to the main road beside a lake with lots of waterlilies. 

The way down there is easy for vans. 
When you are not scared of narrow roads you can go there also with a bigger rig. 
There is only a space for a truck with a view at the lake. Some people are passing by.

name: Next to the Hospital
description: The place is easy to reach also for bigger rigs. The main street ist audible but not visible. Beside there is the hospital. Some people are passing by but no one bothered us. In the evening two cargo trucks came to stay there.

name: Croc Mania (Dog Food)
description: New Shop where you can buy premium dog and cat food. Very nice owner absolutely helpful and he speaks a little English

name: Orange Shop for SIM cards
description:
Official Orange Shop
No prices cause a generous man gifted me data: ) Merci!

name: Nsia Bank
description:
Money Exchange 
Always check what’s on the bill and how much they give you; )

name: Corrupt police with wheel clamp
description:
The whole road shoulder going west is considered by police parking prohibited. There are two no-parking signs on the ground 100 m before Bonprix but it's not clear at all that they mean the whole stretch.

Police clamped car's wheel while I was in Bonprix. Officers talked a lot but the main guy didn't tell me what he wanted.

They went away doing other business. I dug my tools out and removed the wheel clamp. I got cought and they reattached it.

Because I wanted a proper fine with a receipt, we walked a few 100 m east to the police building.

Turns out police chief was worse than the cops. He first wanted 50000 XOF. I ended up paying 15000 XOF and got some pseudo receipt because the normal cashier office was closed. They don't have or want to have a price list of the infractions. Chief wanted an apology after I gave them money but I told them I already paid.

I saw another car with a wheel clamp.

Due to the proximity to the police station I would consider this a permanent checkpoint.

name: Motel Du Chateu d'Eau
description:
Quiet and simple Motel. 
room is clean, shower is clean, water is cold.
Staff is attentive and space in the court to maybe park a car. not suited for high vehicles. 

Ventilated room: 8.000 CFA
Climatised room: 1.2000 CFA

name: Bachalp Hotel
description:
very basic 
room with ventilator 8.000 - 10.000 
room with ac 12.000 - 15.000
shower and toilet in the room 
safe bike parking
space for several cars in the backyard

name: Le Petit Bedon
description:
Le Petit Bedon is a restaurant/bar right on the beach. Sebastian the owner is a very friendly and jovial Frenchman and is happy to let overlander camp in front of the bar for free if you're using the bar. 
Clean toilets and cold showers, highly recommended.

name: Big area
description: Get off the road at the company sign. Just after on your right there is a lot of space. No people walking by.

name: Side road - Batman wildcamp
description:
Right on the side of the road, you are obviously visible but none came around.
If you dont want to pay the CFA5,000 of the Fié place, this point is the right option.
Very well located in town, it is quiet and the ground is flat and clean.
You can watch in peace the flight of the bats and listen to the birds chirping.
Some mosquitos at dusk but nothing bad.

name: Hostile police check
description: Hostile police check. He wanted to see everything in the car, touched all our stuff. Wanted to see our money, came very close and was very aggressive.

name: Le grand roi
description: Great resort with beach access for fair price: 30k cfa for a nice double room (king size bed) with ac and clean bathroom with great shower. Good breakfast for 2 included. Beer 1000 cfa. Perfect to chill for a couple of days.

name: near the track
description: very quiet spot near the track, next to palm trees field .some locals passing by, all very friendly.

name: Tire Repair Shop
description:
Repair tires of cars and motorbikes.
The name of the guy is Saïd, has good material to repair.

name: Local Reataurant
description: 700 for big plate (see photo) first visit was very busy with local kids and teachers. Tasty and handy to eat at on the way to/from camping.

name: Cave la joie
description: Nice cafe next to the water. Drinks available and maybe some food as well. The place is beautiful and the owner Frenk is friendly. He even showed us around town. The town is located beautiful at the lagoon, worth a visit. Nothing fancy but calm and easy.

name: Force quat garage.
description:
Carlos runs this excellent garage and workshop. He can work on all kinds of 4x4 and big rigs. Has electronic diagnostics for all vehicles and trucks etc. Helped us with leaking diff seal. 

Call him on +225 0749 588 888. He speaks English, French and Italian

name: Wheel balancing and alignment
description:
Recommended by Carlos. Balanced our wheels (Toyota LC) and tracking. 10,000CFA. 

Spare parts and diesel injector workshop next door

name: AXA Insurance
description: We renewed our Carte Brune here. Took about an hour.

name: Next to a small village
description: Large space behind some small houses. People very welcoming working in the fields. We arrived late at night and left quite early in the morning. Ask Etienne if you can stay, he is not the chef, but he consider himself as responsable of people here. Road to get there has small water to cross, not possible for rainy season. We have a Toyota Hiace 4wd but without 4*4 it is totally achieveable.

name: Residence tourist hotel
description: Nice hotel double room about $35. AC but intermittent. On street parking but very safe and secure neighbourhood

name: Former lointain
description: Next to the road, but hidden, small carrier which was used for the construction of the road. Few passers-by, just to say hi

name: Hotel les versants du rocher
description:
Hotel on the edge of town with large flat carpark. They allowed us to camp in carpark with our rooftop tent. Gates to compound were shut at night. Toilet available but no shower. If our French was better we may have been able to negotiate the use of a room.
We ate in the restaurant which was good reasonably priced food. 
Nice gardens surround the hotel. Rooms available but we did not investigate. In the end we camped for free.

name: Maryam's food
description:
Very good tasting local food. The lady makes it all fresh. We ate plantains, white Couscous type, fish, eggs and fresh vegetables, nothing spicy (it's optional) for 1500 CFA. They even brought good chairs for us. It's the hut on the left of the yellow barber/ hairdresser house.
We named the mama Maryam, so the location name is not the official name

name: Adama fix
description:
Mitsubishi L200 was reliably and quickly fixed. Our engine was fully destroyed and we were able to drive again on the same day. the price of work was good, some of the spare parts were overpriced but priced by the shop dealer.
very humble and friendly mechanic, called Adama: +225 0706077955

he only speaks french but Google translate works well and he explains what's happening with the car.

name: Bamba Garage 4x4 Mitsubishi & others
description: We got our suspension exchanged here. We paid with material 15.000 CFA. Very friendly boss and several l200 parked for fixing as well

name: Streetparking in quiet, secure neighborhood
description: We slept here for a night. No noises. We enjoyed it, and it's close to a good restaurant

name: Le Savanna
description:
beautiful and super tasty European and African food.
it's wonderful for a date night. price is a bit high but you receive wonderful value. highly recommended! 
It's run by an Ivorian-French family. The owner will come and talk with you. 
The cocktail menu is huge and contains traditional as well as local innovative créations. 
The pulled chicken burger was very tasty.

name: ecobank
description: no fees, ATM works well, you can park in front

name: illux pressing
description:
they have European side load machines and a dryer.
for 5000 CFA we washed two loads. very nice ladies. open from 7:30 am - 8pm

name: Weaver Shop
description:
Coming from Bouake on the highway it's on the right side a bit before this pin. They have a shop as well
They do traditional weaving right on the spot. They will give you a short tour of how they work.
You can buy several fabrics for a good price. 
It's next to the highway, very convenient to stop safely and visit traditional culture of West Africa. 
They are very friendly.

name: Chez le Chef
description:
Beautiful location of a local man. originally from Togo. he speaks German, French and English as he used to work in Germany, The Netherlands and England. He is very humble and friendly. he wears a chef outfit.

Price is a bit high. A very clean environment, including the eating area, toilet space , kitchen and the beach. no trash, also not much along the beach. 
shade from the palms. possible to lay on benches. very local feeling to relax. 

You can observe fisherman pulling out of the sea the nets and if you are keen you can join them in pulling. They are very welcoming. 
You could park the camper there as well
+225 08 05 33 44 for Faustin, the chef, WhatsApp number to arrange everything for you.

name: Orange
description: Can buy SIM card here 1k. they need passport

name: Avikham Lodge
description:
I was passing by and asked if they would allow us to stay the night in our van, with use of the shower in the morning. The price was 10000.

Rooms start at 25.000, breakfast included. 

The place is located on the river, they have a nice bar/restaurant with a TV, stocked with beer and wine, from here you can look out to the Azagny National Park. A few different places to chill. We had a kayak with us so we took it out early morning to observe wildlife in the national park, we could hear some chimps but unfortunately didn't see them.

There is a tap to refill water tank as well as some grass area where it may be possible to pitch a tent. Ate in the restaurant as there is nothing within walking distance. They also had a few boats but I didn't enquire about the price. Arrive early in the day to make the most of the facilities, it was a nice peaceful stay.

Safe parking in gated compound.

name: Le Rocher des amours
description: Big rock formation and viewpoint of the beaches. Worth a visit but be careful of random people demanding money to pass between the beaches, over the rock or over the bridge. Don't be fooled, say no and laugh it off

name: Beach parking
description: One of two car parks for the beach no problem for overnight parking. No guard or payment it is a relaxed area, good phone signal with Orange

name: Beach parking
description: One of two car parks for the beach no problem for overnight parking. No guard or payment it is a relaxed area, good phone signal with Orange

name: San Pedro Market
description: The place to come for buying a variety of fruits and vegetables, meat, some basic clothing and household goods. Be prepared to negotiate for the price, often they will charge more for tourists

name: Benedictine Sister of Bouake Monastery
description: Monastery out of town. Sisters are very nice. Big gated compound. Possible to sleep in the car but they have rooms as well. 15000 CFA/room w/ ac and en-suite bathroom, bf included.

name: La Brioche
description:
Bakery with super delicious, buttery pastry and cakes. They have 

homemade icecream, 
homemade yogurt, 
homemade juices (baobab, ginger-lemon, tamarind) and 
a terrace to sit and enjoy life and sweet treats. Best we had in months!

name: Chad Embassy
description:
Took some time to find it, because they moved twice. This is the accurate location. 

Visa Costs are 35.000 cfa. It’s possible to get an express for double the price and you’ll get it on the next day. Normal waiting time is three days. They’ll call you. 

Visiting by car you’ll need two photos, a hotel booking and a copy of your passport.

name: DRC Embassy
description: The embassy of DRC in Abidjan. The visa requirements and prices are in the list that I appended.

name: Orange simcard
description: In the other orange place (main road) they told me they do not sell sim cards anymore. They sent me here to buy the simcard. Same price 1000 fcfa. They need your passport to activate it.

name: BNI ATM
description: ATM between Abidjan and Ghana border. Doesn’t have withdrawal fees.

name: Orange Shop
description: Here you can buy a SIM Card. Everyone is very nice. To recharge go 20 m back to a Orange Box

name: Police Control
description: Mr. Privat tried to give us a fine because we supposedly didn't stop. But there was no stop sign at all. After a short discussion we were able to drive again without paying a fine.

name: Hotel „Non Stop“
description:
Fan double room 10.000
A/c double room 20.000

Safe parking for motorbikes and bicycles within the compound, for cars they arrange safe parking in the adjacent neighbour‘s yard.

name: in the palm
description:
DON’T GO !!

We were assaulted in the afternoon as we settled in to spend the night.  
4 men violently attacked us (we received blows) and we threatened a machete to rob us.  Beware they are dangerous.  
The area is not safe for wild camping.

name: Corrupt Police checkpoint
description: Very corrupt and a young guy was very aggressive. All the Police man pulled of their names from the uniforms. Wanted to give us a Fine. Wanted to control our smartphones for pictures. After 10 minutes it escalated we told them to call the embassy. The oldest Officer noticed that it will not come to a good end, so he let us go and he asked twice, that we didn‘t gave money to him. Our Tip: make a hidden picture when you arrive at the checkpoint, and Write down the Name of the Officer before they hide their names.

name: Hotel de l‘Amitie
description:
Nice and clean, friendly staff, safe parking for cars and bikes, nice green courtyard and comfortable rooms with en-suite.
We payed 10.000 for a room with a/c and hot water.
No breakfast atm, but bakery 50m away. 
Close to train station.

name: Checkpoint for  passport control
description: Police checkpoint with control of passport and photos of truck and passengers didn't ask for bribes

name: Local Eatery
description: Tasty local eatery with yummy fish soup and rice for 1k CFA. Open on a Tuesday at 4pm, and blasting good tunes in a tropical setting

name: Bakery & Pizzeria
description: Croissants and pan au chocolate. They also advertise pizza and burger but I didn't try them

name: Pizzeria
description:
The place to come for pizza, starting from 6000 for Margarita - thin crust and wood fired. Beers 1000, they also do some local dishes, a big outdoor seating area. 

We slept in our camping car on the grass next to this place, no problems

name: HH service Yakro
description: Multi-service for photocopies, administrative needs. Really nice guys who let me use their wifi for free

name: Tanoe Hotel
description: Basic hotel close to the border. Has fan rooms and AC rooms. 5k for fan room 10k for AC

name: Copy Shop
description: Great, fast wifi here for 100 CFA per hour. Nice guys and there is a/c inside.

name: Marvin Hotel
description: Recommended by Chloe, as her place was full. Decent, good a/c and reasonably quiet. Cheapest room was 15k, and it was spacious, with a bathroom, and clean enough. No bugs and bed was firm. There is an area that might be ok to park cars within the compound, but haven't asked if that's allowed or not.

name: Goshen Hotel
description: Good hotel with friendly staff, rooms with reliable AC and WIFI for 22000.

name: Immigration Cote D'Ivoire
description: 3km before border. Small wooden house. be aware, difficult to see and he asked for  2000 cefa.

name: Piccolo Beach
description: Nice beach bar, they have their own parking area. fast WiFi and a good sized menu, even have vegetarian options. our favourite place in the area including jackville

name: Camping ZALPHA
description:
This camp is a must visit, very hospitable and friendly owner who lives on site, he has an emphasis on keeping the place natural. He owns the surrounding cacao farm, and also grows many fruits like bananas, papayas, coconut and avocados.

Located on the Sassandra river, we saw Manatees multiple times and also took a tour up river to see the hippos. From the camp you can also observe King fisher birds. We paid 5000 per night to stay in our camping car, there are basic bungalows and also possible to pitch a tent. Bucket shower and toilet available, or swim and wash in the river. They make local food or you can make your own.

The owner cares about wildlife and is very enthusiastic about showing his place and what he is growing, genuinely friendly, he made a great effort to speak some English to us, he is happy to learn.

The path to reach the camp is not on the map, from the main road you will see a sign for Camping Zalpha, from here you take the track through a small village and into the farm. The track is a little thin and bumpy in places but we had no problem with our long sprinter 2wd, but anything bigger than this would probably struggle.

The owner, Goue Andre Clotaire is on WhatsApp +2250501103620

If you want food, let him know you are coming as he can’t stock supplies without a fridge.

name: Shopping mall - Cosmos Yopougon
description: Modern shopping mall with free parking. there is a Carrefour, food court, Decathlon and a selection of ATMs. I used Orabank for free withdrawal

name: Customs
description:
This is the place where to stamp in/out your Carnet when coming from or going to Burkina Faso. NOT at the border!!!
Go into the big yellow building, turn left on the ground floor and walk to the last door on the left side. He will fill out the paperwork but not stamp it.
The stamp officer is in the first floor but if you kindly ask they will send someone to go there for you. Much faster.
Guys don’t know how to handle Cdp, so stay vigilant and explain it step by step.

name: DOMAINE BINI HOTEL CAMPAMENT
description: This new accommodation in Tabou point beach (not Tabou city on the border) is the cleanest, relax and beautiful beach that we have been in all of West Africa. No people are disturbing you, they have a lodge with a restaurant, and the tipis are individual medium size tents. Chris is the manager, but Clement has been the king of the service staff.

name: Hotel Carmel (before La Citadelle)
description: previous "Citadelle hotel" with new name that is Carmel. The rooms fee,  from 10000cfa (fan), 15000cfa, 18000cfa (AC), to 20000 cfa (AC). Good if you need to stay in the centre for few days for stuffs and not neccesary go to Grand Bassam.  Private toilet, double size bed, clean and balcony.

name: Gare de STAFF
description: This is a bus to Burkina Faso. Buses everyday at 08:00 and 15:00. You can go to Ouagadougou or even further north if you like to a town called Dori. 8,000CFA to Bobo-Dioulasso and 14,000 to Ouagadougou. You must have a evisa or visa from embassy at the time of writing this. VOA is no longer available.

name: car accesories and mechanich garage
description: Big stock , store, oil, filters, amortiguations, etc. multi brands, they are clear with the prices. you can buy only the products, or also leave yoir car in their garage to change  or repair those  items.

name: Hôtel L'amitié
description:
Nice Local hôtel, very friendly people, rooms start at 5000cfa and they are pretty decent.
Nice terrace at the back

name: Vaccination place
description:
Here you can get ANY vaccine you need or want. No appointment needed. Bring yellow booklet and some cash. That’s it.
Got meningitis vaccine within 12 minutes.
Weekdays from 7:30 - 14:00
See picture for pricelist. 
Yellow fever 8€, Meningitis 10€ etc. Very efficient and fast!

name: hotel Horizon
description: 10000 cfa a room air conditioner, tv, sofa. We kept our 4x4 in the private parking.

name: Malik Hotel
description: Ac room with double bed, TV & cold shower was 10500 per night. Clean enough. We stayed here while recovering from malaria, there is secure parking and a shop over the road to buy water and basic snacks

name: Orange shop for Sim card
description:
Shop open on Saturdays to buy sim card.
They also sell mobile devices

name: Hotel Carrefour
description:
Nice and clean hotel in Seguela.
It has a wonderful shower. The breakfast is not so good. During the weekends can be a little noisy. Irrigation has a swimming pool and a very slowly restaurant.

name: Authentic (!) chinese restaurant
description:
If you have been to China and know the real stuff, this is the place to go. Chinese restaurant made by Chinese for Chinese. Southern Chinese cuisine, homemade Tofu (also in the adjacent shop), all the classic dishes you would expect.
Typical Chinese atmosphere and dining culture. If you know China, you know what that means. Very welcome break from westafrican boring dishes. 
Come early (around 18:00), otherwise no chance to get a table.

name: Service civil
description:
A good place with a parking with guard 
I just ask to guy who worked here for stay for the night in road for Guinee 

Little noisy but it s ok for one night 
There is lot of food selection around

name: Onomo Hotel Abidjan
description: Located within walkable distance from the airport. Has a new wing and what seems to be an old side. Of course any hotel in Côte d’Ivoire without AC is not a hotel. They have a functional wifi.

name: Assurances
description:
Super friendly guy, sorted out a years (shortest available) ECOWAS insurance for a UK motorcycle. Couldn’t get a brown card but he advised, at least in Ivory Coast, that they could only issue those for cars. Cost 30k which was reasonable, got 2 stamped copies, 1 of which he laminated and also a digital pdf. Has a QR code on the form, so easily accessible for checks. I’ll update if I run into any issues with it but so far so good.

Guy in the back room also fixes any type of phone if you need anything sorted.

name: Bereby Market
description: Place to buy fresh fruit and vegetables, among other things. I feel we got pretty cheap (local)  prices here compared to elsewhere

name: Secluded beach
description: To get here take the path from the road into the abandoned resort and down the concrete stairs to the beach. We saw no one here, nice place to come for a picnic and relax by the sea

name: Proceed with caution
description:
Be careful when passing through this village. Close to the market and just before a speed bump, all of a sudden many teenagers ran in the road and pulled out a makeshift tire spike. We had no choice but to stop and roll down the window to find out what they want, of course we already knew, he grabbed my door and shouted "you give me money" Absolutely not. When the the kid let go of the door to write down our number plate on a but of paper, this was our chance. 

Revved the engine loud and accelerated hard, they jumped out if their skins, we managed to narrowly drive around the tire spike. They hit our car and shouted no, began to chase us. We had to run a red light to escape them. Again this reminds us, don't listen to anyone unless they are in uniform

name: Hotel de La Relais
description: Clean, comfortable, convenient. No frills, though. And I don’t think they offer food or drinks so best to stock up before you arrive. Rooms with good AC 12,000 CFA. Plenty of parking

name: Royal Rama Hotel
description:
New hotel in Soubré, excellent conditions, closed parking for 4x4s.  The owner is Mr.  Michel +2250708228272
Rooms from 15000cfa with a/c

name: hôtel mont dent
description: nice place if you want to be near the city centre. 14000 cfa for AC room, 8000 for fan room.

name: La foret des singes sacrés
description:
There are Mona Monkeys in a sacred forest. They are lured with bananas and you can watch the monkeys right at the entrance. 
It costs 2000 XFA.

name: Total Gas Station
description: They accept Visa cards for fueling. And they have a restaurant too.

name: Hotel President
description: Part of a conclave of grand developments in the city.  Like the name says, it was dedicated to the president who used to stay here. We stopped by to have lunch at the top. The view of the city from here is amazing and the food is great too.

name: L'epi D'or
description:
Fantastic well stocked bakery! One of the best outside of capital cities that we have seen 
very reasonable prices (400cfa for a croissant au chocolat) and lots of choice of breads and pastries 
also a restaurant on site but we didn't sit down and eat so can't comment on the service

name: cooking gas refill station
description: They refilled our EU Gas bottles for 7500 XCA for 10 kg.

name: bel hôtel
description: had a look at hotel sonia around the corner but it was pretty gross and run down. here they have legitimately european standard rooms for 15000 fcfa. all rooms have AC.

name: ATM Visa
description:
Bank is few meters before the coordinate s.
Yellow Building

name: Hôtel grâce good location
description:
This is the good place of the hotel,
Still up and running 

Verry nice place with lovely staff,
8000cfa for a fan room and possibility AC but I don’t know the price 

Verry clean

Big parking for 4x4 maybe 5 can fit inside

name: Mahapleu Water fall
description:
Verry nice waterfall where you can swim, 
500cfa to get in

name: 12 arrondissement police station
description:
You’ll find here the police station that give you Certificat de Residence,
Easy 
Just go there with 2000cfa (no change)
You wait you’re turn and it’s done 

Just need passport
Adress somewhere in Abidjan 
Phone number

name: Bunker
description: wonderful local Restaurant with fresh fish located direct on the beach of the Lagune. It's also a place you can stay over night

name: Next to Monolith
description: Nice and quiet spot under a mongo tree with beautiful vieuws of the Monolith. A few locals around very friendly

name: Au château - local restaurant
description: We stopped in this very nice local restaurant for lunch and it was super delicious ! We took chicken with "sauce aux graines ", foutou (banana paste, super tasty) and rice for 1500 CFA /person. You Can Park next to thé restaurant and sit in the shadow. Plenty of local people eat there, dont miss this place! Nadège will welcome you with a Big smile !

name: Bad condition
description: The road is in Bad condition, from Daola to San pedro

name: Polyclinique Farah
description:
Great clean private hospital where you can find good doctors in a lot of fields.
People are friendly and can help you.

They also have an emergency service open 24/7.

name: Commissariat du 26ème (residence certificate)
description: Here you can do certificat de résidence for 2000cfa. Very quick, you only need your passeport and an adress in abidjan.

name: Supermarket Cash Côte d'Ivoire
description: Supermarket with some decent choice, some imported products.

name: Abobo second hand parts (car breakers)
description:
If you need second hand parts, you can go there.

It's a shop, where they can find all parts in car breakers.

They can find Mercedes, Toyota, Renault parts...

With very good prices !

Friendly people.

name: NSIA Assurances
description: I took out insurance for our 7.5 ton truck here for 3 months for 35,000 CFA. I had to negotiate, but it wasn't a problem.

name: Residence Hote
description:
nice and clean rooms for 15.000 cfa (negoatiable). very recommendable.
parking only for max. one car, which shouldn't be higher than 2,4 m (guessing the hight).

name: Boulangerie Resto Sénoufo
description: Fastfood restaurant with a decent selection and prices. Also a bakery and ice cream shop !

name: Centre Spirituel Marianiste Village
description: Abidjan is a crazy and polluted city, and if you are here to wait for a visa or just passing by, we can not recommend enough this Marianiste mission. They are in a quiet neighbourhood, have secured and guarded car park, with few spots in the shade. You can either camp if you are self-sufficient or take a room. The rooms are simple but clean and with fully working and quiet AC, shower and private toilet. There are many options starting from 10,000 CFA pp pn in a room with a fan and no food, up to 20,000CFA pp pn in an AC room, and 3 large meals included. With the hotel prices in Abidjan this does not seem that expensive and in addition they have fast 5G Wifi and most importantly you will not be disturbed by drunk people or prostitutes, obviously you should have a respectful behaviour, it's a Church at the end. Don't know how much it would cost to stay in the car park, but i guess they will take a donation. If you want to save some money, you can negotiate the price before, by getting in touch with the reception or pop in for a chat. They will welcome you with open arms. ±225 0708055398 or 0789660877

name: OLA Energie
description: This is the last real fuel station before heading south on the poor dirt road to Tai village. Fill here with reliable petrol or diesel, many places on the way have only poor quality fuel for Motos

name: Ora bank
description: Ora bank atm to get cash. they don't charge a fee for usage

name: Hôtel Lucia
description:
Very beautiful hostel with river view.

Beautiful rooms : 25000 CFA for a A/C room for 2 persons.

We slept in our 4x4 for 3000 CFA with shower and toilet access.

Beautiful river !!

name: Hotel Doufoulougou
description: Guesthouse with Ac room for 10000 XFA and Fan room for 6000 XFA. Clean and central. Easy to get to with a tuktuk. They cost 200 XFA and plenty of options around to find some grilled fish.

name: Byblos Restaurant
description:
Really good Lebanese restaurant in the Center of town. Family owned and the owner Said is extremely welcoming and helpful. 

Also near Atlantique hotel that was reasonably priced.

name: Top Moto
description: Motorbike shop that has nearly everything you could need at European standards

name: La Roche Rouge
description:
Beach Bungalow  Hotel, with possibility to camp under the trees. 4x4 recommended because of some deep sand.  Restaurant with cabana and bar.
For campers they have bucket toilet and shower.  Friendly staff and right next to the beach. 
Bungalow per night 35000 cfa
Camping per night 10000 cfa 2 persons.

name: Square Gravel Place
description:
Square (20x20m), level gravel place next to the road. Little vegetation, that will block a single vehicle (<3.5t). In general big enough for trucks (<18t). Arrived at dawn and left shortly after sunrise. Only for recommended for a single night.

Traffic is moderate to low between 11pm and 7am. Expect some traffic noise.

name: small appartment
description:
small  appartement.  double bed. small living room. kitchen equipped. Air conditioning. around 20000 cfa.

call Mathurin +225 0710751963

name: Hotel Kennedy
description: I came here cause the fan rooms in all other options were full. Clean hotel with (quite big) rooms starting at 5000 CFA. 24/7 electricity and water. In theory there is a Wifi network, but they told me it wouldn’t work at the moment.

name: Agboola Automobile Tailor
description:
Aboola repairs, sews, reupholsters all the seats, foams, seats, armchairs... he redoes leather steering wheels and gear shift knobs too. he redoes bicycle and motorcycle saddles. Really nice job, and not expensive !
Contact : +225 01 43 41 45 96

name: La Citadelle Hotel
description: Cheap hotel, 8k for a room with a fan and bathroom. Ok for a night and the cheapest I could find in the area

name: Mosquée du Plateau
description: Really nice colourful mosque. inside completely air-conditioned. We gave the security guy a little tip of 500 XOF and he let us shoot a few pictures inside.

name: BANCO NATIONAL PARK
description: 10.000 XOF for foreigners (5.000 XOF for ECOWAS people). Tuktuk 500 pp each way (they told you that not exactly but 500 is one way). My advice is to walk the 3 km, it's shady, and the way is even and no problem), you will see more forest and maybe animals as on the inner parc, cause there is party by the locals). Beware of the guide! Our (Roger) said after leaving the parc that there is a guide fee (10.000). We discussed a time and refused that, and leave without the payment. If you have the same problem just ask him to go to the counter to discuss and solve the problem, that would help). ask the guide before the tour or just refuse the guide at the beginning, you don't need it (e.g. they lost the key for the museum so even with guide you will only see through the open windows). at the pond with the "restaurant" there is a tasty tamarind juice for 500 and simple toilets. At the little village inside you can buy fish food for 500, it's worth because there are huge fish's (catfish).

name: Palais Présidentiel de Yamoussoukro
description: You can visit the palace, if nothing important happend at the time. Talk to the guards. The said you have to write a letter to the office to get an invitation. but for 20.000 CFA you can talk a visit. We negotiated to 10.000 CFA. You don't see so much, but's fun to drive with the guard throw the place, only 15 minutes.

name: Corrupt money changer
description: Corrupt money Changer. Watch out for this guy. It cost us €35,- When he is counting again the bills you gave hem, he will “discover” that the amount of money is less than you gave. He has really fast fingers… He was wearing a Croatia soccer shirt

name: Embassy of Equatorial Guinea
description: New address of the Embassy of Equatorial Guinea. Extremely bureaucratic. They ask for a lot of documents to issue the visa (like bank statements, criminal record certificates and other b***hit). The price is 200k CFA. That’s absolutely insane. They will make everything so you don’t go there, like me after all that.

name: Katoum
description: A beautiful hotel and restaurant overlooking the sea. The rooms were out of budget for me, but for 10,000 CFA you can have a nice meal (grilled fish, pizza etc.) and enjoy the beach beds and the pool ! A really nice spot for a lazy day.

name: Péage
description: Another péage. 7,5 t truck, Classe 2, 2500 CFA. Friendly, got a receipt.

name: Péage
description: Another péage, truck 7,5 t, wanted to charge Classe 3 first, but told them we always paid Classe 2, 2500 CFA.Worked out. Friendly ladies!

name: office about nearby national parc
description:
here you can find some info about nearby national parc (mont Peko and mont Sangbe)
I guess if you are in this area but interested about another parc, they can also give you some infos. we were interested by mont Sangbe, but apparenty it is very hard to see animals during rainy season (hard to go there because of water, hard to see animals because of high grass)
very friendly people

name: hôtel le bronx
description: nice downtown hotel. 10000 for a fan room, 13000 for a crappy AC room, 17000 for a nice AC room, and 25000 for the deluxe suite. i got the 17000 nice AC room, the room itself is pretty small, bathroom is tiny but gets the job done. AC is cold. has hot water but it’s so hot here anyway. within walking distance to main attractions, as well as supermarkets, restaurants and bars. there is a reasonably priced restaurant (2000 for a half chicken, add 500 for rice/fries), there’s also a bar/nightclub.

name: hôtel calma
description: nice place with shops and restaurants around. 8000 for a fan room, 12000 for an AC room, 14000 for AC room with hot water. breakfast included with price (bread, omelette or sausage, coffee or tea and a choice of juice). wifi didn’t work.
